tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=4, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Enterprise Sales Representative at Eagleview Technologies Inc.

Remote

REMOTE-US-BASED

Company Information

Mixing technology, data, and first-in-class innovation, EagleView® is not only leading the property data analytics market, but also changing lives along the way. Come join us and make great things happen!

EagleView is a fast-growing technology company driving game changing innovation in multibillion-dollar markets such as property insurance, energy, construction, and government. Leveraging 17 years of the most advanced aerial imaging technology in the world, along with the most recent advances in machine learning and AI, EagleView is fundamentally transforming how our customers do business.

At EagleView, we believe that making our culture engaging and empowering are keys to success. Our kitchens are stocked 24/7; social, athletic, and wellness opportunities are plentiful; and the growth, education, and potential of employees is a top priority, making EagleView a “Best Place to Work” for more than five years running.

Job Description

We’re hiring for an Enterprise Sales Representative focused on driving our business in our key markets. In this role, you’ll be relied upon to maintain and grow current client accounts as well as aggressively pursue new business. The person that’s going to be successful in this role is going to be a self-starter, resilient and driven to win with deep interpersonal skills and the ability to craft creative solutions.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Source and develop potential client relationships and actively manage existing client base.
  • Identify opportunities for increased revenue and volume.
  • Actively develop relationships with key users.
  • Conduct strategic account reviews regularly to review service needs and usage trends.
  • Define business objectives by identifying products and pricing that meet customer needs.
  • Create and conduct proposal presentations and RFP responses.
  • Identify business trends and forecast demand.

Skills & Requirements

  • Strong documented history of success and top performance.
  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience.
  • 3+ years of sales experience.
  • Experience with enterprise sales strongly preferred.
  • Sales experience one of the following markets strongly preferred: Government, Insurance, Energy Infrastructure, Construction

EagleView® offers competitive pay and robust benefit plans along with the opportunity to grow your career in a fast-paced, fun and casual environment.

EagleView and its subsidiaries are committed to leveraging the talent of a diverse workforce to create great opportunities for our business and our people. EOE/AA. Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran.

Apply for job

items.title: Senior Sales Sourcer
items.content:
Senior Sales Sourcer at Splunk

Remote | Freelance

Location: Any city in the U.S. (must already be located in the U.S.)

This role is a Sourcing role, and we are looking for someone who loves to source and build pipeline for Recruiters

Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey.

This role is contracted through end of Splunk’s fiscal year (end of Jan 2020) with the possibility to extend based on performance and business need.

The Role:

Due to our hyper-growth in building a game changing product, we are seeking an extraordinary Sr Sales Sourcer to join our dynamic and fun Talent Acquisition team. If this is you, you have experience in building a robust pipeline of high-caliber software sales talent, and you have ability to demonstrate an “outside of the box” approach in your search methodology. As a Sr Sales Sourcer, you will demonstrate your creative searching skills to track down critical sales talent for building cutting edge software. You will communicate intelligently with your sourced super-candidates, persuade them to engage and interview at Splunk, and partner with Hiring Managers and our Recruiting Team to maximize their interviewing experience. You will be responsible for sourcing of passive sales technology professionals and leading them through the entire recruitment process up to the offer stage.

Responsibilities:

  • Become an expert in Splunk technology, new products, applications, and how to prospect & convert passive folks into interested applicants.
  • Create and execute talent strategies based on deep understanding of business needs aligned with understanding of the candidate market place (both internal and external).
  • Utilize knowledge of multiple recruiting sources and advanced sourcing techniques to identify candidates. Drive sourcing activities via networking, internet research, local, regional and national recruiting forums focused on diversity
  • Generate a strong qualified engineering pipeline, and produce a target list of passive candidates for assigned searches through research and heavy sourcing; research, networking, cold calling, and phone screens.
  • Source passive candidates through referrals, networking, internet searches, communities, etc.
  • Build communities of talent

Requirements:

  • 3-7 years experience sourcing technology/software sales superstars at enterprise software companies and a successful reputation and references to back it up.
  • Extensive experience in sourcing gained at either an executive search firm or from a fast paced, high-growth enterprise software environment.
  • Demonstrated success in sourcing and recruiting IC and management level sales candidates within the enterprise software sales space including Cloud, Big Data and the IT industry with tact and tenacity
  • An eye for detail and strong intuition for culture fit while screening candidates
  • Understanding of sales methodologies, technology, ability to read and understand what makes a stellar Sales Consultant or Technical Sales Reps successful
  • Able to establish trust and credibility with Sales Leaders and influence talent decisions through a consultative approach, when working with our sales hiring managers while taking new requirements, reviewing candidate profiles and updating candidate pipeline progress.
  • Ability to partner effectively with all teams in a matrix organization
  • Highly articulate and collaborative. Ability to network and establish effective relationships
  • Leads by example: A great teammate who is inclusive, collaborative, self-directed, highly motivated with a sense of urgency.
  • Deep expertise in building and networking with high caliber software sales talent. Ability to demonstrate creativity in your search methods and generate a high quality candidate pipeline under very tight timeline. Knowledgeable with using Boolean logic and LinkedIn Corporate Recruiter.
  • Knowledge about other ways to strategically find great and collaborative Sales Candidates through social media and external referrals (you know how to use more than just LinkedIn)
  • Hi-integrity; hi-degree of professionalism, and can be trusted with confidential HR information.
  • A strong bias for action,impeccable follow up, results-oriented mindset, not scared by stretch goals.
  • Strong negotiating, closing, and follow-through skills
  • Strong social networking and a strong brand ambassador
  • Experience with Applicant Tracking Systems, Jobvite is a plus.
  • Growth mindset
  • This role can be remote.
  • We are looking for a strong sourcer who has experience and passion for sourcing sales candidates. Please include that experience on your resume.

What We Offer You:

  • A constant stream of new things to learn. Including cutting edge internal recruiting tools.
  • Highly talented, collegial and dedicated peers.
  • Breadth and depth. Do you want to make an impact? The work you’ll do will directly impact our product, brand and the experience of our candidates.
  • Growth and mentorship. We believe in growing our talent through ownership and leadership opportunities.
  • An open, supportive and collaborative work environment.
  • Work Flexibility. We don’t expect people to work 12-hour days. There will times where we will sprint, however, we want you to have a successful time outside of work too. Want to choose your hours? No problem. Need to work from home periodically? No problem? We trust our colleagues to be responsible with their time and commitment to providing an extraordinary candidate, manager and team experience, and believe that balance helps cultivate an excellent environment.

We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which you are applying.

For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Apply for job

items.title: Platform.sh: Sales Development Representative - APAC Timezone

items.content:
Sales Development Representative - APAC Timezone

Mission

Call it what you want, Platform.sh isn’t your typical SaaS company, and this isn’t your typical entry-level sales role. We’re a 100% distributed organization, focused on redefining how organizations build and run web applications at scale. We help our customers bypass all the complexity and cost of infrastructure and DevOps, and enable them to focus on creating incredible experiences for their customers with software. Platform.sh counts everyone from Fortune-50 enterprises to scrappy SaaS entrepreneurs as partners, and we’re looking for curious, customer-focused individuals to help us find and win more.

How do we win? By making it easy to work with us. By making it easy to buy. By understanding our customers business and challenges. We’ll expect you to dive in and learn, and be on a daily mission to help our prospects choose Platform.sh.

This role will report to the sales organization, working in close collaboration with the VP of Sales.You’ll also work closely with our distributed sales team. 

In a given day you might:

  • Interact with inbound prospects through conversational channels to engage and qualify them for further sales engagement, or to optimize self-service flow.
  • Prospect enterprise partners through multiple channels, and work with our global account exec team to qualify.
  • Contact existing partners and customers to help them engage further with our product and/or team.
  • Work with sales and marketing leaders to develop and refine outbound and inbound strategies.
  • Wrangle spreadsheets, LinkedIn, and CRM data to figure out strategies to connect with buyers 1:1. This job is about working smart, not just “hitting your dials.”

Must-have skills:

  • Curiosity! You must be driven to learn about our customers, their businesses, technology (ours and theirs), and B2B sales.
  • Communication. Being a distributed company, we don’t have the benefit of walking around to see one another, so proactive communication is a must. We’ll expect you to both give constructive feedback and ask for help when you need it.
  • Organization. Data is our lifeblood. We need to be great at collecting and organizing prospect and customer feedback to tune our sales/marketing process and product, and feed our customer acquisition. We use Drift, Marketo, and Salesforce primarily. Knowledge of or ability to learn is key!
  • Comfort with pace and uncertainty. We’re moving fast, growing quickly, and figuring some things out. We don’t bullshit, and we support each other. You need to be comfortable with helping to figure things out along the way.
  • Goal orientation. This is a sales role after all. We’re all about developing qualified leads and pushing the business forward.

Apply if:

  • You’re inquisitive and analytical.
  • Want to work in a fast-paced environment, collaborating with a globally distributed [and rapidly scaling] team.
  • You care more about learning and pushing yourself than ping pong, snacks, and kegerators.

Sound Like a Good Fit? We’d love to talk to you!  

* This is a remote job. Candidates must be located in the APAC Time Zone.

Technical Sales Lead / Sales Engineer (United States)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Industry: DevOps, Internet of Things, Software Development
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Balena | No office location

Technologies

docker
embedded-linux
linux
raspberry-pi
iot

Job description

On being a Technical Sales Lead or Sales Engineer at Balena

We run sales like we run engineering. While closing deals is important, we’re more interested in helping customers succeed with balena and solving their technical challenges. We’re also a process-driven team and work to make our sales process as efficient as possible.

We mostly focus on inbound sales for now, understanding the needs of potential customers, helping them discover what about balena is most helpful for them, onboarding them to our platform, and ultimately helping them grow their business and scale their IoT fleets. We succeed when our customers succeed.

Responsibilities

  • Identify and nurture leads from our user base, inbound requests, events, etc.
  • Engage with potential customers and guide them through their evaluation of balena by providing demonstrations, answering technical questions, and explaining how balena can address their specific needs
  • Maintain relationships with existing customers, help them continue to grow with balena, and take ownership of expansion, renewal and upgrade opportunities
  • Manage extended customer projects (such as an enterprise proof of concept)
  • Develop tools and methods for improving process efficiency and automation
  • Focus primarily on leads and customers in the United States

REQUIREMENTS

Need to have:

  • Ability to understand and empathize with customer needs and requirements, and work directly with customers to address those needs.
  • Willing and able to learn complex technical subjects and develop a deep understanding of the balena platform.
  • Equally skilled at presenting to business executives and engineers.
  • Highly organized, able to handle many threads at once, and keep things moving - you’ll be interacting with many different customers on any given day.
  • Ability to navigate the sales process within organizations ranging from small startups to large multinationals.
  • Self-motivated and able to drive results without too much management.
  • Desire to make yourself and others more effective. You’re always looking for ways to improve the process.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and fluency in English.
  • Based in the United States of America and willingness to travel locally.

Nice to have:

  • Technical or engineering background
  • Experience with balena-related technologies (e.g. Docker, Linux, IoT devices like the Raspberry Pi)
  • Experience working with IoT companies
  • Understanding (and healthy skepticism) of sales processes and best practices
Apply now

About Balena

Balena provides a software platform that helps developers build, deploy and manage code on connected devices. We brought Docker to embedded GNU/Linux devices in 2013 and have been building our IoT toolkit ever since.

Our technology is open, standards-based, and proven in production across a wide range of scenarios from drones, 3D printers, point-of-sale devices, tidal turbines, skyscrapers and more. Our investors include DFJ, Aspect Ventures, GE, and Ericsson.

Balena is a highly distributed, remote-friendly company with a pretty much flat hierarchy. Our organization is adaptive, getting feedback signals from our users and systems. Right now we organize ourselves by projects, which allow us to build complex features and solve big problems, while staying mutable. As a distributed group, we rely on clear communication and the rule of "assume positive intent" to help us work together across time zones, cultures and first languages. Our base of operations is nominally London, though really we are living all over the world: from Barcelona to Bulgaria, Argentina to Vietnam, and many more.

We come from 15+ countries, and we embrace a remote culture with flexible hours. To us, this means being highly productive while still maintaining a healthy work-life balance. You need to be able to work remotely, and have a dependable internet access available so you can join video calls.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We value knowledge and initiative more than educational and personal backgrounds, age, or location. We maintain a work environment in which team members are treated with respect at all times and in which thoughts and ideas can be shared openly.

We communicate proposals, discuss with others in the team and accept feedback if it makes the result better. We value the ability to learn, which is more important to us than knowledge of specific technologies. We know that learning fast means being outside our comfort zone, which is OK -- we'd rather learn than let our assumptions get in our way.

Benefits

  • Work with extremely talented, distributed team
  • Work remotely
  • Flexible working hours
  • Equipment of your choice
  • Annual company gathering in an international location
  • We send you hardware for side projects!

items.title: Business Development Manager
items.content:
*About Us*
SCOPE Procurement Solutions is a young tech-start-up in the construction industry. We provide an online B2B platform for the procurement of professional services, such as architects, engineers, quantity surveyors and project managers.

SCOPE is pioneering in this market in the UK and our goal is to revolutionize construction procurement on a global basis, making markets more transparent and supply chains more efficient.

Targeting rapid growth in this sector, we are now looking for a Business Development Manager to play a key role in generating new business leads.


*Your Skills and Experience*
As Business Development Manager, you will have proven experience in securing business in the construction sector and as such will be highly connected within the industry. You should have a good understanding of construction projects and related procurement processes. You will display passion and inspire confidence in those around you encouraging a strong team ethic.

Key requirements for this role are:
* At least 2-3 years of business sales experience
* Very strong network in the construction industry, especially property developers, project managers and quantity surveyors
* Experience in using different client-acquisition methods, including telephone and email sales, online platforms such as LinkedIn and face-to-face meetings, e.g. at networking events
* A first-class track record of sales performance, excellent rapport building, negotiation and communication skills
* Experience of using a CRM system
* An aptitude for working towards targets and deadlines and devising a personal strategy to hit and exceed them
* A friendly, outgoing personality who enjoys working in teams


*Responsibilities of the Business Development Manager*
The Business Development Manager will be an exciting full-time role with a considerable impact SCOPE’s success. You will be responsible for identifying opportunities and managing client relationships across the UK and potentially worldwide.

As part of your role, you will develop a wide and close network of client relationships to generate and maintain business. You will be responsible for establishing a company sales strategy as well as building and managing SCOPE’s business development department as the company grows.

Key responsibilities include:
* Generating new business across all allocated products and territories and promote repeat sales
* Cold calling and messaging to generate new business as well as converting warm leads
* Effectively maintaining the CRM system
* Be the face of SCOPE by attending conferences and conducting client meetings
* Closely managing existing customers, offering online and face-to-face support
* Create and implement a sales strategy for products and territories to meet sales targets
* Mentor more junior members of the team


*Our Benefits*
At SCOPE, we believe that a positive work culture is essential to promote business success. This is why we offer all our employees a wide range of great benefits, including:
* Exceptional *opportunities to grow* within a young tech-start-up
* Fully *commission-based salary* with immense upside potential (an option including a base salary will be offered once sufficient business has been generated)
* Additional performance-based *bonuses*
* *Flexible workplace* culture, allowing you to work from anywhere
* *Flexible working hours*, working around our clients’ schedules
* Generous allowance of *30 holidays*
* *Many more* benefits as the business grows (e.g. cycle to work scheme, private health insurance, 13th salary etc etc)
* And most importantly, the exciting opportunity to be part of a *young innovative company’s* journey, being a key person with *huge impact* on the business’ success and having a great time within a *small but growing team* of passionate, driven people.


*Be Part of the Story*
We encourage a diverse workforce and inclusive workplace, and welcome applications from different backgrounds. Just click the Apply button to submit your application.

items.title: National Sales Account Executive
items.content:
National Sales Account Executive at CyberCoders

Remote

Washington, DC

Full-time $120k – $200k

Ready to make a real impact in a growing, prominent local & education focused consulting company? We help local & nation-wide procurement managers to increase their SLED business & save public government entities millions of dollars in the process. We’re made up of former fortune 500 executives, state & local officials & procurement consulting veterans helping us lead our space for over 10 years running. Although our preference is to have this person located in our beautiful, Washington DC office, we are happy to bring on someone remotely with the right type of experience.

What You Will Be Doing

  • Achieve revenue goals put in place by the company
  • Actively finding & closing business with Large Enterprise accounts, helping them open up & expand their SLED business
  • Prospect new business opportunities by staying on top of market trends and conducting market research
  • Identify Key accounts of prospective clients
  • Participate in educational opportunities, read professional publications, maintain personal networks and participate in professional organizations
  • Retain and grow existing business partnerships through up selling and maximizing revenue
  • Stay organized and maintain accurate client data through a CRM platform
  • Maintain organization confidentiality

What You Need for this Position

  • BA, BS (MBA is a plus) & 8+ years of relevant experience selling services, solutions, technology, etc. into fortune 500 or other large accounts
  • Strong background in full-sales lifecycle, selling into major corporate accounts for a well-known brand or entity
  • Proven experience rising the ranks in a sales organization (i.e. Seller —> Sales Manager—-> Regional Sales Manager —–> National Sales Manager, etc.)
  • Account Management, background ballooning accounts through consultative sales is helpful
  • Proven ability to form & grow professional relationships
  • SLED sales experience is a plus

What’s In It for You

  • Flexible Work Environment with Work from Home Options
  • Great Company Culture where your coworkers are your peers, not “bosses”
  • Competitive Benefits Package (Base up to $120k + $200k OTE)
  • We pay offer Standup desks in our sleek, new office space, Laptop of your choice, Health/Vision/Dental, expense reimbursement, 401k match

So, if you are a sales manager, national sales director or business development director with experience selling to Fortune 500 companies, please apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Preferred Skills

  • Regional or National Sales
  • Selling to Major Accounts
  • Prospecting
  • Negotiate Contracts
  • Fostering Relationships
  • SLED
  • Cold Calling

International Sales Executive

Opportunity to join a fast-growing international tech school with headquarters in London and offices in Beirut, Jeddah, Riyadh, Kuwait, Bahrain and Oslo.

Location: Remote

Opportunity:
• Join a fast-growing tech academy on the ground floor and help us grow to 15 cities by 2020.
• On the job learning of the latest tech skills and frameworks to enable you to achieve your targets.
• Supportive team and culture that is positive, fun and exciting.
• Opportunity to be working with some of the region’s leading brands & governments - putting a dent in the massive skill gap in the region.
Tags: Sales, Enrolment, Tech Education, Growth


Hello, we’re Growth Velocity Academy.

We understand that there are a lot of smart people out there that don’t have access to practical hands on skill building courses.

Since 2017 we’ve been creating and running cutting edge digital marketing, growth hacking workshops and boot camps for start-ups, corporates as well as career transitions looking to upgrade their skills.

What we’re looking for:

• First and foremost, you must care about what we do – helping people gain in demand skills to secure jobs they love.
• We’re looking for a dependable and enthusiastic Sales Executive that takes initiative to work directly with the Growth Velocity Founders.

Job Brief:

• We are looking for a Sales Executive that will take ownership of closing various leads that are looking to sign up to one of our One Week Intensive Digital Marketing Bootcamps taking place in our designated cities.


Responsibilities:
• Creating a virtual sales environment to make calls and close deals
• Hitting sales targets and maintaining profit margins
• Researching and on boarding potential partnerships with key partners in designated cities
• Sales
• Responsible for driving/converting students to bootcamp via chat and calls
• Using GVA Chat/Sales script as supplied
• Ensure ticket prices are sold at agreed levels
• Marketing for each of the events (including but not limited to):
• Reaching out to new and existing contacts
• B2B
• Approach list of corporates & universities that may be interested in our courses
• Personal Network (if applicable to you)
• Reach out to personal contacts to both sell tickets and to help you open doors to corporates
• Team projects
• Supporting team on projects (in line with quarterly objectives, discussed with line manager)
• Team responsibilities
• Being present on weekly sales & team meetings
• Having weekly meetings with line manager
• Updating weekly reports for your region
• Targets
• Day of workshops (if taking place) – 100 tickets sold
• One Week Bootcamp – 30 tickets
• Maintain sales budget.
• Maintain “sales playbook”.

Specific Skills:
• Prior Sales experience
• Responsible leader with an analytical and strategic mind and have a broad knowledge of the business.
• Committed to compliance
• Communication skills
• Attention to detail

Language Requirements:
• Fluent in English and Arabic

Cultural Fit and Values
• Be humble but confident
• Move fast and systemise
• Deliver a WOW experience
• Lead by example
• Nurture and grow

Communication
• Weekdays, Mountain time business hours, by Slack, Skype, Phone, Text, Email
• Every Monday and Friday, Skype Video with the team

Compensation
Commission based on performance.
Growth Velocity Academy will be investing a lot of time and energy training the right candidate to potentially grow into a leadership position within the business.
The founders have a strong track record of growing team members into leadership roles within their previous start ups.

Contact
If the role is of interest, please send your CV and a few lines explaining why you think you’re a good fit.

items.title: Sales Account Manager
items.content:
Hello!

 

Our team is looking for a solid, experienced Remote Account Management specialist in the accounting/tax industry who is a native English speaker and who would be available during NY business hours.

 

We provide an easy to use and extremely affordable software to accountants and tax practitioners that helps them streamline their office environment to make doing business easier for themselves and their customers.

 

Our core clients at this point are small to medium sized accounting offices who are struggling to keep things organized and grow their business.

 

What we need is someone who can reach out to prospects who have expressed interest in our system, registering for a demo webinar, and performing the necessary follow up once they do to turn them into paying customers!

 

Who’s our ideal candidate?

  • Experience in calling clients and prospects to set appointments, some of whom might be cold leads that haven’t been contacted by us yet
  • Experience in the tax and/or accounting industry so you can “talk the talk.”  This isn’t 100% necessary if you are smooth and polished on calls and can learn quickly...but it would be nice if you had some familiarity
  • The ability to work uninterrupted during normal business hours
  • A keen understanding of who your audience is and the level of professionalism that you must have
  • Someone who has helped onboard and support business customers

 

At this time, the hours requirement is very reasonable (3 hours a day), but we will be getting much busier shortly so we hope to find someone with flexibility.

 

Additionally, to be certain you’ve read this entire posting, please start your proposal by telling me what the weather is like by you right now. Those who don’t follow this simple instruction will be rejected immediately - which is great for you since you've read this part :) 

 

Thanks!  We look forward to hearing from you!

AMAZING pre-sold leads

Surgeon income from home

A Fun and Flexible working environment

A World Class Program to sell

Sales training with a legendary sales trainer

The ability to change lives

Sylvie McCracken

items.content:
Villa Sales Specialist at World Travel Holdings

Remote | Entry-level

Villa Sales Specialist

Job Locations: US-Remote

Category: Sales

Type: Regular Full-Time

Are you passionate about sales? Do you possess luxury travel experience? Would you like to work from home? If yes, this may be the role for you!

World Travel Holdings is seeking a Villa Specialist to work in our Luxury Division. In this role, you will maximize revenue by successfully building client relationships, closing sales, and maintaining client relationships that generate repeat business and referrals. Completing paper work, administrative functions and other non-phone work related to the effective processing of customer Villa rentals to provide a remarkable client experience.

About World Travel Holdings
World Travel Holdings is the world’s largest cruise agency and award-winning leisure travel company with a portfolio of more than 40 diverse brands. In addition to owning some of the largest brands distributing cruises, villas, hotels, resort vacations, cars and luxury travel services, World Travel Holdings has a vast portfolio of licensed private label partnerships comprised of top leisure travel providers, including almost every U.S. airline, leading hotel brands and prominent corporations. The company also operates a top-rated travel agency franchise and the country’s original host agency, and is consistently recognized as an industry leader in work-at-home employment. Its global presence includes operating multiple cruise and vacation brands in the United Kingdom. World Travel Holdings has offices in Wilmington, Mass.; Ft. Lauderdale, Fla.; Virginia Beach, Va.; New York, NY; and Chorley, England. For more information, visit WorldTravelHoldings.com.

© World Travel Holdings Inc; 100 Fordham Road; Bldg C; Wilmington, MA 01887; USA

Responsibilities

  • Handle all company supplied villa leads in a polite and courteous manner, and in accordance with WTH sales guidelines. Convey enthusiasm to customers with a genuine desire to be of service.
  • Effectively identify the full extent of the customer’s requirements to optimize sales of villa products and services. Use your product and destination expertise to make full-experience recommendations to the customer.
  • Work with villa suppliers to confirm availability, process and release holds, and invoice the customer once a purchasing decision has been made.
  • Inform customers of the appropriate terms and conditions along with any other relevant information relating to their villa reservation. Highly recommend the purchase of trip protection throughout the quoting and booking process.
  • Input reservations using the company reservation and invoicing system. Ensure comprehensive and accurate collection of all appropriate customer information, and send invoice, contract and accompanying documents to customer in a timely manner.
  • Complete paper work, administrative functions and other non-phone work related to the effective processing of customer villa rentals.
  • Execute Villa’s “Guest First” philosophy in all interactions.
  • Build rapport and long-term relationships with customers.
  • Maintain periodic contact with existing and prospective customers through outbound efforts to generate new business and build a repeat client base.
  • Ensure performance goals are achieved consistently and in accordance with WTH luxury brands quality standards.
  • Initially deal with customer inquiries and complaints involving the Supervisor or Customer Service when appropriate.
  • Work with peers within the villa division Buddy System framework.
  • Report to assigned team meetings and/or training sessions.
  • Enhance product knowledge by completing online, on-demand courses as required.

Qualifications

  • Minimum of 2+ years selling luxury travel; experience with villa travel preferred
  • Demonstrated ability to interact successfully with affluent clientele
  • Strong destination-based knowledge of popular luxury vacation destinations such as France, Italy, Mexico, Europe, Hawaii and the Caribbean
  • Highly motivated to sell; ability to build strong customer relationships and offer exceptional service
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills to include personable, professional telephone etiquette
  • Self-disciplined and accountable for achievement of goals, continuous learning and self-improvement
  • Demonstrated proficiency with the internet and Microsoft applications including Word, Excel and Outlook
  • As a work at home agent, you must be able to provide a designated space for a home office free of distractions, high speed internet connection (minimum Internet speeds of 2.0 Mbps upload and 5 Mbps download) and a separate phone land line (not over the internet) dedicated to this position. Please note this home office must not be in the same residence as another current World Travel Holdings’ at home employee.
  • Must be able to work a flexible, full-time schedule (40 hours per week). Core hours for villa sales are Mon-Fri, 8a-8p EST and Sat/Sun, 9a-6p EST (hours subject to change).
  • Must be a resident and live in one of the following states: AL, AZ, AR, CO, CT, DE, FL, GA, ID, IL, IN, IA, KS, LA, ME, MD, MA, MI, MN, MS, MO, MT, NV, NE, NH, NJ, NM, NY, NC, OK, RI, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VT, VA, WA, WV, WI, and WY

items.title: Junior Purchasing Buyer
items.content:
Junior Purchasing Buyer at Danette May Mindful Health

Remote | Entry-level
  • Remote
  • Full Time
  • Product Management
  • Entry Level

Mindful Health is the company behind America’s Leading Healthy Lifestyle expert, Danette May. Danette May is also the founder of The Rise movement and the superfood company iRise Organics, and the author of the book The Rise: An Unforgettable Journey of Self-Love, Forgiveness, and Transformation (Hay House 2018). She is also the bestselling author of the books 7-Day Jumpstart, Bikini Body Detox, and Bikini Body Recipes. Her programs include the online coaching and membership program Fit Rise; exercise DVDs, recipe books, online health and fitness challenges, and healthy lifestyle and mindfulness coaching. The Danette May brand focuses on the three pillars of healing: healing foods, healing movement, and a healing mindset.

Mindful Health was named #48 on the Inc. 500 2018 list of the fastest-growing private companies in the US. Through our various entities, iRise Organics and FitRise, we strive to change the world via healing & organic foods, sustainable eco-friendly packaging, and a healthy approach to body movement and mindfulness. We seek individuals who are passionate about healthy living, are on a personal path of growth and are committed to transforming the world around them in their own way. We believe that we are all individually empowered to change the world.

For more information on our Company and culture please visit www.danettemay.com/career

This position is fully remote, telecommute, work from home.

Intent:

The Junior Purchasing Buyer will have the main responsibility of planning, organizing, and supervising the comprehensive purchasing functions for the nutritional supplement, superfood, and overall products business of iRise Organics. This individual will have a strong focus on compliance with mandated requirements and will oversee daily activities related to major purchases. Will also respond to a range of inquiries regarding processes or outstanding purchase orders and invoices. They will report into the Director of Products and will assist with negotiating terms and conditions with vendors and/or service providers and achieving department objectives and goals within budget.

Description & Influence:

  • Maintain all purchase orders, manage invoicing process for all products and orders with our main fulfillment center, as well as vendors
  • Track inventory levels and products to ensure adequate stock levels
  • Source, price, and purchase raw materials, components, and operating supplies
  • Issue, follow-up on, and maintain purchase order system, including files
  • Maintain production schedule for weekly meeting as it pertains to material arrival date.
  • Work with Quality Control to qualify new vendors and raw materials
  • Obtain proof of Certificate of Liability Insurance from vendors annually
  • Obtain Bio-terrorism Registrations from vendors and follow up as necessary
  • Obtain Certificates of Analysis for all raw materials and Finished product
  • Obtain Specifications Sheets when available
  • Liaison with fulfillment centers: Update Inventory, PO, ASNs, RMAs, Ending balance, and order special inventory for special events.
  • Obtain Vendor Qualification reports: Yearly
  • Site visit and Audits in the absence of Quality Auditor
  • Maintain vendor files
  • Assist in determining purchasing schedule
  • Maintain professional relationship with vendors
  • Work alongside Director of Products to negotiate pricing with vendors
  • Work with Accounting to ensure invoices are paid on time
  • Ensure cGMP and FDA compliance with the Purchasing function
  • Understand and abide by the policies detailed in the Employee Handbook
  • Due to changing workloads, employees will be required to work in multiple areas and may be required to perform other duties or tasks on an as needed basis.
  • Perform additional projects as delegated by the Director of Products

Background & Experience:

  • 2 years experience with Manufacturing ERP Systems. A preference will be given to Process Pro or Batchmaster.
  • Associates 2 year degree preferred in accounting, business management or similar experience
  • Ideal background in nutraceuticals, pharmaceuticals, parts manufacturing, food or nutritional supplements
  • Must obtain a working knowledge of regulatory/quality requirements and perform within all Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and policies.
  • Moderate to Expert(preferred) MS Excel, Word.
  • MRP experience preferred
  • Strong attention to detail with an ability to plan and manage projects
  • Strong understanding of accounting principles as they relate to invoicing payment and receipt tracking
  • Articulate and able to interact and communicate with outside vendors and internal stakeholders
  • Inventory management experience a plus
  • Contract negotiation a plus but not required
  • Purchasing and cost/expense management.
  • Able to function in a quality driven environment.
  • Typing speed of 40 WPM
  • Strong work ethic with the ability to take ownership, roll up sleeves, and get things done
  • Must have an entrepreneurial spirit
Apply for job

items.title: Program Advisor
items.content:
Program Advisor at GreatAuPair

Remote

(Inside Sales Rep)

Synopsis

If you’re a proven inside sales champion with excellent customer service skills who appreciates the art of building relationships by listening and relating to customers’ needs while thriving in a remote team environment, then this role may be for you. As Program Advisor, you must have a genuinely warm and polite demeanor, a positive outlook, be professional and articulate in your verbal and written communications, and efficient in your actions. You must be able to handle many tasks at once and be independently motivated while collaborating with coworkers from multiple departments.

The Role

The Program Advisor role is an essential part of GreatAuPair’s excellent customer service. The Program Advisor serves as the first point of contact for new customers and is therefore the most important outward facing representation of GreatAuPair. The Program Advisor is responsible for making outbound calls to families and answering incoming phone calls and emails, to understand the customers’ needs and to represent the value of the GreatAuPair J-1 Au Pair Program. Your goals will be to help host families complete their application with ease and confidence, then support them to find the best au pair match from our pool of qualified au pair candidates.

The successful candidate could be characterized as a confident, quick learner with superior communication skills and a commitment to quality customer service that is second to none. You are a smart professional who is capable of helping host families understand the value and benefits of the au pair program. You have superior organization and time management skills that help you to juggle competing priorities and customer needs. Your entrepreneurial spirit creates a “can-do” attitude and your ability to think outside of the box will allow you to bring forward new ideas to enhance your department. You have a minimum of 4 years of similar experience, a solid knowledge of Microsoft Office applications, Google docs, database systems; Internet and social media tools.

The Program Advisor reports to the Host Family Services Manager in the Sales and Marketing department and is responsible for converting leads into customers to meet monthly sales goals for host family recruitment.

Compensation

Competitive base + commission. Earning potential of $45K+.
Position will be contract to permanent after successful three-month trial.

Requirements

The successful candidate will possess the following qualities, assets, skills and experience

  • This is a full-time, remote position with benefits for the right professional
  • Must be able to work some evenings and weekends.
  • 4-year degree or similar experience
  • 4+ years of experience in sales/marketing, recruitment, hospitality, administration, communications or human resources
  • Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills to communicate with customers, coworkers, partners, government entities, and others critical to the agency’s success
  • Excellent problem solving skills
  • Exceptional organizational skills, attention to detail with the ability to multi- task
  • Ability to manage high volume of inbound and outbound phone calls and emails on a daily basis
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office, database, Internet and social media applications
  • Passion for cultural exchange program development
  • Passion for increasing customer satisfaction and retention
  • Consistent, positive “can-do” attitude with the confidence to back it up
  • Must be kind, authentic, friendly and courteous
  • Promotional and sales experience plus
  • Strong preference for second/third language skills – a definite plus

Job Duties and Responsibilities

The Program Advisor has the following duties and responsibilities

  • Represent the company as the primary point of contact for new host family customers via phone and email; directing inbound calls to appropriate staff as needed
  • Quickly and professionally resolve customer issues by providing guidance and information regarding company services, products, procedures and terms
  • Establish and build trust with customers at every opportunity
  • Promote the value of company’s services to customers
  • Receive and process sales calls when customers wish to pay by phone
  • Call and email new leads and assist applying host families to ensure timely application completion
  • Monitor and report ongoing progress of families in application
  • Update online customer records as required for all transactions
  • Monitor and maintain leads and tasks in the CRM
  • Establish follow up schedules and tasks for aging leads to keep them current
  • Update internal account records to ensure synchronized data between the CRM and customer Grid system
  • Provide management with regular activity status reports
  • Resolve customer complaints by investigating problems
  • Maintain professional and technical knowledge
  • Monitor competition by gathering current marketplace information
  • Handoff successful applicants to Placement Specialist
  • Conduct reference checks for matched families
  • Maintain family file folders to ensure DoS compliance
  • Other tasks and duties assigned by the HFS Manager

Performance Criteria

  • Meet or exceed customer satisfaction goals
  • Meet or exceed monthly sales and placement goals
  • Meet or exceed Department of State compliance regulations
Apply for job

items.title: B2B business development lead
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
WHO IS BEELINE?

Beeline is on a mission to help the world have better journeys on two wheels through great navigation software and hardware. Founded in 2015 by Mark and Tom, two friends who wanted to solve getting lost in London on their bikes, Beeline has now grown into a healthy young business with big ambitions to grow (currently in discussions with VC backers to accelerate this further)


Beeline’s first product, the Velo, is a beautifully designed device that sits on the bike handlebar and gives navigation guidance to the rider. It was launched on Kickstarter in 2015, and has since sold over 10,000 units. The Moto (the edition for motorcycles) is launching this month and has already taken over 9,000 pre-orders. The first deal to integrate into shared bikes and scooters, or micromobility, has recently been confirmed, with several others in the pipeline – the number of Beeline users will at least triple in the next 9 months. In parallel, we’re building machine learning mapping and routing algorithms dedicated to bikes and scooters, with backing from the European Space Agency.

Micromobility is set to be part of the transport solution for our ever more crowded cities. So it’s not only the hottest topic in tech right now but done right, has the potential to have a real impact for good by decongesting and depolluting our cities.

We firmly believe that great navigation will be a key enabler to that growth and are very excited to have closed our first deal (the first in the industry). However, we want to be THE navigation provider to this whole industry, not just to one player, and we need someone to lead the charge on that ambition.

WHO WE'RE LOOKING FOR:

We’re looking for someone to work directly with the founders of the business to drive our growth into micrombility. The role will be a blend of strategy and sales - becoming an expert in this fast growing industry and building strong relationships with decision makers inside some of the fastest growing tech companies right now as well as the city officials who are trying to keep up with them. You’ll also help shape our product strategy by bringing your thinking to how we offer value to these operators beyond just navigation and cement our position as an invaluable layer in the industry.

You’ll have a year or two of commercial experience under your belt and be comfortable with market analysis. More important than your experience will be your ability to think analytically, look at the big strategic picture and most importantly, be fascinated by how the shifts in urban transport could change the shape of cities in the future!


IMPACT OF THE WORK:
Two wheeled transport is set to play a huge role in the future of our cities as well as a leisure activity, and we think our products will be a key enabler to this growth. Bike use is growing for good reasons – the combined impact of improving citizens’ health and wellbeing as well as the broader environmental benefits make this a no brainer.

The trend in micromobility is a huge driver in this change (as well as two wheeled delivery fleets like Deliveroo and Uber Eats and the growth of e-bikes). Providing them with great navigation will both enable them to grow and maximise their positive impact and will likely be the strongest area of growth for our business for the next few years. So you’ll be absolutely pivotal in the success of Beeline as well as making the world a better place.


WE CAN OFFER YOU:
A competitive salary and generous options (shares)
Hands on startup experience working with the founders in a business-critical role
A part to play in the future of urban transport
A relaxed, supportive and jovial team culture - we aim to take our work seriously without taking ourselves too seriously. Socials in the pub or running round the local park are commonplace!
The opportunity to shape the future of this young, growing company

YOU CAN OFFER US:
1-3 years commercial experience (likely finance or consulting, but not a must)
Interest in the future of cities and mobility
A rounded skillset:
Research skills
analytical skills for developing Go-To-Market strategy
Strong interpersonal skills for developing relations with cities and operators
Creativity, especially for product strategy
Comfortable designing and implementing processes - this is a fairly new role in a fast-paced area: adaptability and speed of execution will be crucial

items.content:
Bid Analyst at Abbott

Remote

DO WORK THAT MATTERS

At Abbott, diverse ideas, perspectives, and expertise allow us to create the life-changing solutions that help people live healthier lives. In 150 countries and with businesses spanning nutrition, diagnostics, medical devices, and branded generic pharmaceuticals, Abbott offers you enormous opportunities to explore your interests and help you achieve your career and personal goals.

We have an exciting opportunity for a Bid Analyst – Contracts Administration within our Abbott Rapid Diagnostics business located in Santa Rosa, California. Will consider remote for the right candidate. In this role, you will responsible for identifying and responding to Redwood Toxicology Laboratory’s bid opportunities in a timely and professional manner while adhering to Abbott policies and procedure.

Abbott Rapid Diagnostics (formerly Alere) is part of Abbott’s Diagnostics family of businesses, bringing together exceptional teams of experts and industry leading technologies to support diagnostic testing which provides important information for treatment and management of diseases and other conditions.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Research, review and respond to applicable bid and quote opportunities per standard protocol and within required timelines
  • Coordinate with departments within RTL and SBU to garner required information and approvals
  • Perform pricing analyses and recommendations; maintain up-to-date bid resource files
  • Negotiate contracts following bid awards and effectively transition to Sales
  • Sustain and manage relationships with purchasing officials; and participate in special projects as assigned

The Bid Analyst’s responsibilities include a unique blend of technical writing (proposal content), project management, sales, and business analysis. As such, the role requires not only technical skill, but also versatility and the ability to thrive under pressure.

IDEAL QUALIFICATIONS OF A SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE

  • 5+ years’ experience in Sales, Sales Operations, and/or Contracts Administration experience is preferred. However, an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to perform job duties may be considered.
  • Bid and/or contract administration experience
  • Experience in sales or client-facing position
  • Technical or business writing experience
  • Possess above average writing skills – you may be asked to provide professional writing samples for evaluation
  • Be extremely detail oriented
  • Be self-motivated and able to work independently
  • Have an aptitude for multi-tasking, moving between projects and duties quickly and efficiently
  • Be an effective communicator both verbally and written
  • Be able to learn and absorb knowledge, which may include scientific terminology and concepts
  • Be able to learn and navigate multiple database programs
  • Be able to work under stress conditions and handle stressful situations efficiently and effectively
  • Be capable of successfully meeting critical deadlines under pressure
  • Establish and maintain strong working relationships with co-workers, management and clients
  • Be computer literate with above average proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite
  • Possess exceptional organizational skills
  • Possess excellent time management skills

About Abbott

At Abbott, we’re committed to helping people live their best possible life through the power of health. For more than 125 years, we’ve brought new products and technologies to the world — in nutrition, diagnostics, medical devices and branded generic pharmaceuticals — that create more possibilities for more people at all stages of life. Today, 99,000 of us are working to help people live not just lo

items.content:
Senior Account Executive, Marketing Consultant

Senior Account Executive, Marketing Consultant
We're looking for a high performing salesperson with the ability to onboard new clients and maintain accounts. OUTRIGGER ADVISORY GROUP is a marketing and operations consulting firm offering a full-service automated marketing and analytics systems customized to help companies increase their revenue.

You tend to have an entrepreneurial-like working style. You're proud to help others and are an expert at the consultative closing technique. You connect with people and build rapport with ease. You enjoy helping customers grow their business. You're a go-getter, yet you're not out to sell just anything to make a quick buck. Your ethics and drive to produce long-lasting partnerships are a high priority. You have great relationships established with decision makers with SMB's and/or larger corporations. You are a fast-action taker and hit the ground running without overanalyzing. You like a fast-paced workflow and thrive on getting results for both our team and our customers. This role will report to the CEO directly and will be an integral part of the team. This role is partly remote. The selected candidate will be meeting with companies on-site as well as attend scheduled meeting both online and in-person.

APPLY HERE - http://bit.ly/2Vu5xB2

What you’ll do:
As an Account Executive, you will consult with businesses to discover their marketing needs and present proposals for workshops and/or marketing services. You will have training on the systems and learn our consultative closing methods to better assist customers and close new business. Metrics will be established with you to determine your level of commitment and ability to find and close new business. This is mostly a remote position with weekly in-person meetings via internet, phone, or in-person.

Primary Responsibilities:
You will mainly be following our sales and marketing plans and conducting prospecting and sales related tasks. You will produce and maintain lead lists, make initial contact to establish rapport, and meet with prospects to analyze their current marketing strategies. Once you understand what they need, you will research their online presence and develop a customized report and develop a proposal. Then, you will deliver the presentation and offer workshops and the best multi-media options to support their objectives.

Experience and Skills:
·     5-8 Years of sales experience with a marketing agency or a small business in a sales role
·     Understands digital marketing channels, such as Facebook ads, YouTube ads, Instagram ads, and Google Ads
·     Proficient working with spreadsheets and entering data and CRM's
·     High energy with a positive attitude
·     Strong work ethic with a drive to produce sales
·     Self-starter, capable of working independently
·     Self-managed
·     Provide reports and input data for various metrics
·     Attend events to prospect for new business
·     Speak at events as an expert in the industry
·     Capable to follow a system for lead generation
·     Capable of time management and conducting income producing activities
·     Follow-up on leads and current clients
·     Work with the structured marketing plans and input data into CRM
·     Task-oriented
·     Well-versed with marketing automation technology
·     Capable of outreach including cold calling, meeting face-to-face
·     Willing to provide info for a background check and work-related references
·     Reliable transportation with a valid drivers license and insurance
·     Be able to sit for several hours at one time at a computer, capable of driving to and from appointments, and have high-speed internet access

Ideal Candidate:
·     Has experience selling marketing, workshops, or corporate training packages
·     Has a database of businesses in Colorado or a book of business
·     Previously ran business development for a small business
·     Bachelor’s Degree in Communications, Business, Marketing, PR, or Media
·     Understands the consultative closing technique
·     Thrives on learning new skills and growing new business

items.content:
Location: Remote Remote
Role and job type:   Community   Full-time

Job Description

We are seeking a highly motivated, competent, and proactive Account Manager to acquire and develop long-term relationships with clients and customers in Russia. This position will report to the VP of Growth, and will be an integral part of a cross-functional team of Marketing, Sales, and Customer Success.

The Account Manager oversees a portfolio of assigned key clients, develops new business from both new and existing clients, and seeks partnerships to help EMX grow. The ideal candidate will have an entrepreneurial spirit and passion for problem-solving and relationship building, strong knowledge of cryptocurrency and the derivatives markets, as well as extraordinary communication skills that quickly establish trust and rapport.

Responsibilities

  • Identify and acquire prospective clients and customers in Russia
  • Achieve and consistently exceed monthly volume goals
  • Serve as a trusted primary point of contact for client onboarding, inquiries, issues and escalations
  • Act as a domain expert for EMX; learn and thoroughly understand the EMX trading platform, and both current and future service offerings
  • Respond to customer queries in a timely manner, on official company channels: Telegram, Email, Zendesk, Slack, VK, etc
  • Enhance EMX’s reputation by owning client requests and providing the best client experience in the financial services industry
  • Report regularly on client issues, recommendations, feedback, and trading activity, to improve product and business development
  • Organize and attend industry events, and act as an outward-facing ambassador of EMX’s mission, brand and products
  • Create presentations and sales materials to share with prospective clients
  • Distribute localized marketing materials to relevant bloggers and media in Russia

Requirements

  • Fluent in English and Russian at a professional level
  • 3+ years of experience in sales, account management, customer support or similar client-facing role in a fast-paced, results-driven environment
  • Previous experience and/or strong interest in outbound sales and prospecting
  • Strong knowledge of the cryptocurrency derivatives trading space
  • Superior ability to communicate with stakeholders at all levels of an organization
  • Experience managing accounts and high-value clients, with a track record of building strong relationships
  • Excellent analytical abilities to assess partnerships in terms of financial, strategic and operational implications
  • Extreme respect for security and privacy
  • Self-motivated, assertive, and proactive
  • Flexible, able to both acquire new customers and also manage existing partnerships by providing a high level of customer service including timely responses to inbound inquiries
  • Accountable with a strong sense of ownership and integrity
  • Motivated by EMX’s mission and creating a seamless support experience for our global customer base

Preferred Qualifications

  • Previous experience working in a fast-paced, dynamic tech company
  • Previous experience working in a start-up
  • Strong ties to local derivatives trading community
  • Proficiency in CRM tools and processes, e.g. Zendesk, Hubspot

Salary range

Negotiable

items.content:
Location: Remote San Mateo CA
Role and job type:   Other…   Full-time

Job Description

This role is primarily to work on BitBounce Ads and focused on growing it into a major advertising business.

We are hiring Sales Development Representatives and Account Executives to help bring in new business and you will be one of the first on the team to execute our strategy as well as assist in building our structure and processes. We help our customers understand, craft and execute effective marketing campaigns so they can grow their business with BitBounce. This is an early, important role that is critical to our business and revenue growth.

CORE ACTIVITIES:

  • This is first and foremost a hunter role. You’ll be actively prospecting new business opportunities, onboarding customers onto BitBounce Ads as well as developing relationships with existing clients.
  • Responsible for the business development, client engagement, and sales life cycle of the BitBounce Ads platform to customers globally
  • Conduct in-depth research to identify lead opportunities and present sales strategies to BitBounce leadership
  • Document and track all potential and existing client interactions and lead follow-through using internal tools
  • Execute detailed on-site product presentations and web demonstrations of our software capabilities to C-level executives, directors, and marketing managers
  • Support BitBounce customers by acting as a product expert as well as helping them with questions and any roadblocks to them being more successful with BitBounce.
  • Designing product and process improvements with engineers, identify customer feedback and bugs.
  • Help shape our product and growth strategies.
  • Be responsible for reaching or exceeding revenue goals.
  • Attend select industry events to find new customers.

QUALIFICATIONS:

We are looking for smart, resourceful teammates with a passion for our products and helping our customers succeed with BitBounce products.

We specifically expect the following:

  • Clear and concise writing and structured thinking.
  • Highly collaborative disposition
  • Curiosity and interest in BitBounce products. If you have not already, signup for our products before we meet.
  • High level of empathy, a trustworthy personality and proven record of sales success.
  • An understanding of advertising and tech industries.
  • Knowledge of the cryptocurrency and blockchain industries is helpful.
  • Startup experience is preferred but not required.
  • Software Sales experience is preferred but not required.
  • Advertising Sales experience strongly preferred but not required.
  • This position will require occasional travel both domestic and internationally.
  • Knowledge of HubSpot products is helpful.

COMPENSATION:

  • Full time salary plus uncapped commission for closed sales
  • Opportunity for equity in a rapidly growing company
  • Health Insurance
  • 401k

Salary range

$50-65k base salary, uncapped commissions, equity

items.title: Business Development Summer Intern
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=6, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=26, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
DataSwift Summer Interns will gain a full immersion into the role of a technology salesperson, supporting every aspect of our business development pipeline. This role is intended to set undergraduate students up for a successful career in business and technology, working in a fast-moving team in a quickly scaling Startup.

You're curious, and we love that. Every business development role you’ve ever seen, or dreamed of, has been interesting to you - but it always seemed a little too much like grunt work. You’re interested in meeting people, building a network, gaining some skills, and putting your education and skills to some great work right away.

You want responsibilities, opportunities, a place to learn and a time to shine. A way to meet and engage with clients learn about new businesses.

You're one of those people who tries to keep your introduction of your company short, so that you could hear all about the people you’re talking to. You ask questions, find opportunities and gaps in knowledge, and try to bridge the gap between what people need and what you have learned (and can offer).

If you're for that kind of challenge, get in touch.

We need:

• a customer-centric, empathetic mindset

• ability to soak up knowledge...

• ...and transfer it, simply and effectively

Your colleagues and fellow students say you:

• are easy to work with

• are always on top of the latest tech/apps/trends

• think laterally

• are driven but...

• ...don't have sharp elbows

• are a person they would also enjoy going to the movies or having a coffee with

Your mom says that you:

• have been reading the business section of the newspaper since you were 10

• are an inventor at heart

• get your hands dirty

What’s in it for you:

• you get an immersive education in the real world, and full autonomy

• a complete crash course on early stage startups, investment, technology, and sales

• a brill new network that will sort you for life

• flexible work: working from home when you want, where you want, why you want to (we trust you)

• continual learning & development opportunities

• quarterly sprints around the world - we’ll fly you in for team building and learning (the last one was in Cyprus)

• a competitive stipend to help you pay rent

Compensation: £10,000-25,000 commensurate with experience

Equity: 0.01 - 0.025%

DataSwift is rewriting how the entire technology industry - the entire world! - builds apps and websites. The days of companies owning all the data, and doing whatever they want with it when the users have no say are over. We’re helping make more modern, more decentralised technologies with an infrastructure that’s going to scale to take over the world. We’ve been covered in Wired (https://www.wired.co.uk/article/gdpr-personal-data-private-data-accounts) and the Financial Times (https://www.ft.com/content/3278e6dc-67af-11e7-9a66-93fb352ba1fe) and we’re looking for someone like you.

Get in touch with us through our partners at Mark and Maven by emailing Maven Camilla at maven.camilla@markandmaven.com.

items.title: Sales Representative
tags: DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
items.content:
ABOUT US:

SkipsoLabs is a tech company that helps corporates build out their Innovation Ecosystems and manage their Innovation programs. Our company is a market leader in providing crowdsourcing, idea management and open innovation platforms for top corporate clients worldwide such as Microsoft, Deloitte and Disney just to name a few. We offer a combination of crowdsourcing, game mechanics and big data analytics, to scout new technologies, drive product development, create new revenue streams, foster a culture of innovation.



WHY JOIN US:

You will have the opportunity to work alongside the management team and have regular interactions with industry leading clients. This is a great opportunity for anyone who loves the Internet and would like to work in an exciting high-growth start-up. If you are looking for a challenge and would like to become a key part of a fast-moving tech company, get in touch!



THE IDEAL CANDIDATE:

Somebody that is ready to take on any task or challenge. If you don't know how to achieve a goal you look it up and propose the best solutions within the context of SkipsoLabs. You are intelligent, curious, articulate and can adapt to any situation. At the same time, you are an active listener and are open to discovering alternatives to your solution. Most importantly, you have a great work ethic and are respectful to your co-workers and clients.



If you’re a goal-oriented team player with a competitive spirit, and up for your next challenge, we’d like to speak with you.



RESPONSIBILITIES

Build a network of qualified prospects via desktop research and Linkedin
Communicate daily with prospects with outbound emails and cold calls
Organise and manage demos of our products to potential clients
Prepare daily reports on sales activity and KPIs
Work closely with Sales Team Director
Shadow Sales Director on calls and presentation
Achieving growth and hitting sales targets

REQUIREMENTS
0-2 years in an outbound selling, lead generation, or customer contact environment (preferred)
Bachelor’s degree or set to graduate in May 2019
Great work ethic and outstanding communication skills (verbal and written English)
Results-driven personality (base salary with performance-based commission)
Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
Ability to work in a team and independently (self-motivated)
Based within the European time zone
Experience working in a software company (a plus)

BENEFITS
Competitive salary + Commission
You will be an essential team member, contributing to the growth of our company from day one
Work with a highly creative and entrepreneurial team
Join our company at the right time and be sure to become a part of our core team if you do a good job (and if you enjoy your time with us!)
Remote working allowed
Awesome offsite team meetings

items.title: Regional Sales Manager
items.content:
This is a unique opportunity to impact every renter in the UK through exciting and highly rewarding work.

Join us on our mission to create a world of deposit FREE renting!

We expect more people to rent than ever before. That’s why we believe renting should be more affordable and accessible. We are a young and innovative startup solving an affordability problem by offering deposit-free renting to millions of tenants across the UK - with lots more exciting stuff to come.

We have built a core team and a product we are proud of, raised significant seed capital and partnered with the UK's largest independent letting agency. Plus, we’re currently working with the world’s largest institutional landlord so we’re well on our way to driving the renting revolution!

As a Regional Sales Manager, you will work in the northern regions of the UK to help flatfair meet its ambitious growth targets (although we'd want to see you in the London HQ once or twice a month!). This field-based role needs an experienced, go-getting sales dynamo to drive innovation, growing flatfair through strategic partnerships and representing the brand as we continue to scale across the UK and further afield.


Focus of the role?

Identifying, attracting, negotiating and launching partnerships with a variety of landlords, property managers and letting agents, both public and private, in the area of Northern England and Scotland
Manage full life cycle, from initial outreach, through onboarding to relationship management
Account manage existing relationships in the region, optimising our partnerships and identifying future opportunities
Focus on providing an outstanding sales experience to flatfair's potential partners, effectively communicating our vision and platform, and building a greater network within the industry
Being an ongoing thought partner for agencies, partners and suppliers by leading on strategic initiatives and high level planning
Identify marketing, event and networking opportunities for flatfair to attend/sponsor or speak at
Be able to deliver a perfect elevator pitch over the phone and in person as well as writing carefully crafted emails
Effectively collaborate remotely between the London based HQ account management, business development and tech team to ensure all customers enjoy the full flatfair experience.


Who are you?

Extensive experience (10+ yrs) in sales with a strong network within the property/lettings industry
Driven by closing new business, you'll love the thrill of discovering what makes potential customers tick and communicating how flatfair can support them
Excited about the idea of working autonomously to contribute to the growth of a fast-scaling startup
Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically
A car owner, you'll be willing to travel across the north and Scotland


What’s in it for you:

Uncapped commission: This role is all about growth, and we want to incentivise you to succeed. With a competitive basic salary and generous uncapped commission, as well as travel expenses, you'll be looked after
Flexibility: We want you to be your own leader and encourage an autonomous and flexible work style right across the business
Socials: We like to bring everyone together for a weekly team lunch, regular social events and get-togethers in a fully stocked kitchen with snacks, fruits and drinks (and you’d get to lead on organising them!)
Holiday: 25 days holiday a year (plus UK public holidays), and we encourage you to use them all up!
Learning and training: We’ll contribute towards training courses and conferences that help you learn and grow professionally and personally
Personal development: Following a motivating career path, we value growth from within and encourage people to step up


--

Note to agencies and third parties: we have a team who owns all of our talent processes at the moment and are happy with how we’re growing. We love your enthusiasm to work with us, but we’re not looking for new partners currently so please hold off on cold-calling us for now.

items.title: Business Development Representative in London
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
items.content:
Join a fast-growing London UK scale-up and sell a Product that is Turning Heads.

Trint™ is the scale-up that blows manual transcription out of the water. Its browser-based platform converts any audio or video file to text in just minutes. Then Trint’s interactive editor marries audio to the text, making it easy to search and polish transcripts to perfection. Hours of tedious labour are reduced to just minutes. Users can add captions in one click and effortlessly make the content of their recordings searchable and shareable. And we have a lot more tricks up our sleeves!

“By far the best automated transcription platform.” The New York Times

Early adopters include: The Associated Press, BBC, The New York Times, ESPN, Vice News, The Washington Post, Thomson Reuters, Indiana University and The State of Wisconsin.

The role:

We’re looking for a candidate who will help us supercharge Trint! You will be a key part of a team that is accelerating sales across EMEA and North America.

Responsibilities will include:

This is primarily an outbound sales role, focused on lead generation in our fast-moving sales team. You will support Sales Managers by handling incoming leads, and by proactively reaching out to prospects for our Enterprise offering. You will achieve that through B2B outbound phone calls, emails and events across multiple industry verticals and companies.

As a Business Development Representative, you will focus on:

Sales: Qualifying inbound leads for Sales Managers, and completing the sales cycle for SME prospects.
Prospecting: Identifying key markets to target and qualifying against our solution to determine fit for our Enterprise offering.

Cold outreach: Performing a number of daily outbound calls to generate client bookings, effectively pitching Trint’s solution and value proposition

Email Lead Generation: Creating a list of prospects and targeting via high volume outbound campaigns as well as individual targeted emails

CRM Maintenance: Data collection, maintenance of sales records and recording information on opportunities and prospects in Salesforce

Target Achievement: Achieve team and individual sales targets set by our Commercial Director.

Required skills:

- Prior sales and business development experience, focused on outbound lead generation
- Proven prospecting experience in a B2B context
- Strong business development skills in new sectors and markets
- Experienced adopting new technology, with aptitude to develop and teaching new technical workflows
- Most importantly, you will be engaging on the phone and be the kind of person that our customers love talking to!
- Confident in speaking with C-level Executives and extracting information and requirements to build a solid value proposition
- The mindset to strive and succeed in a dynamic startup environment

Helpful skills that will make you shine even brighter:

- Additional languages (HINT: we support 13 languages)
- Know-how of SaaS selling
- Startup exposure
- Working knowledge of a cloud-based CRM

Benefits:

- Team Events & Beer Fridays
- Opportunities for international travel
- A relaxed & sociable office environment
- Gym Subsidy
- Office Snacks
- Flexible working & working from home
- Cycle to Work Scheme
- In-house Yoga
- 25 Day Holidays Allowance + Bank Holidays
- Critical Illness Cover
- Income Protection Insurance
- Workplace Pension Scheme

And more to come! We’re on the look-out for new and exciting perks which help us on our journey to becoming an employer of choice

Salary based on experience + OTE plan
