items.title: Sales Executive
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
items.content:
Location:

London or remote.

What we do:

OnCare is a software platform for social care. We make care easier, safer, and more effective. We've started by making tools to help home care providers manage care delivery, and will be growing our platform to become the future marketplace for all types of care.

We’re a tech for good business, making care easier for everyone – care workers, agencies, people receiving care and their families, and we know that by doing this we can raise the standards of care across the board.


A day in the life of our Sales Executive:

We’re looking for a bright, energetic Sales Executive to join the OnCare team. In collaboration with our marketing efforts and the CEO, you’ll help us to achieve over 10x growth in our customer numbers, through a mixture of phone and email outreach, and face-to-face visits.

You’ll be selling software into domiciliary (homecare) agencies. This is a traditionally paper-based and non-techy market - so an ability to explain complex concepts in a simple, non-threatening way, and ability to vary your communication style based on the audience are key to this role.

You'll be responsible for all aspects of the sales cycle from customer outreach and creation of sales collateral, through to managing relationships with existing clients, creating sales strategies, and helping to optimise sales and marketing channels.


You'll love working with us if:

You take pride in selling technology that does some real good in the world
You enjoy working in a relaxed environment and like working to clear targets
You want to be part of a small but dedicated team of problem-solving experts with an open communication culture contributing to the wider business goals
You can tolerate occasional puns that are so bad they need to be explained, and you don't hate Beyoncé


What we offer

items.content:
Job description

We are looking for an experienced, ambitious sales person to join our team. Your job would be to find potential clients who would be interested in outsourcing their projects or departments to Croatia and close deals with them.

If you have a good network among London's entrepreneurs, you are independent, result driven and you can progress rapidly, this might be the perfect job for you!


About us

Remote Bob is connecting remote employees from Croatia with London based start-ups. We have a team in London and in Croatia, our co-founders are both serial entrepreneurs with an MBA.

We are enabling London based start-ups to outsource their projects and departments without
compromising in quality. Here, in Remote Bob, we can reassure all our clients that the delivered work will be exceptional. Our remote employees are based in the EU, and we are offering local support; recruitment, people management, training, quality check and payroll. With our help, working with a remote team has never been easier!

Benefits

A chance to be a significant part of creating the biggest hub with remote employees in Croatia, gaining knowledge from co-founders and earning a competitive salary.

When sending your CV please answer these questions:
1. How would you acquire clients?
2. What target would you set for yourself for the first 3 months?
3. Salary expectations?

items.title: Freelance Business Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Bespoke Brand Developers is a Digital Marketing agency located in the heart of Covent Garden, established in 2017. We help businesses generate leads and ultimately increase revenue.

We are looking to take on 2 Business Developers.

The people we are looking for will be confident, articulate and highly-motivated characters.

This is a freelance position which can be done from the comfort of your own home, with sales scripts and lead lists provided. This opportunity is ideal for someone who is working part-time or student and looking to fill their time and earn some decent money.

You will be appointment setter, and further down the line closing clients on the phone yourself. If you're not comfortable with cold calling, this position probably won't be for you.

You will be calling businesses offering our Social Media Marketing services initially, while also offering web design, SEO and digital marketing consultancy.

Our social media marketing packages start from £1,500 and range to £10,000 a month.

NOTE* As we are a startup, this is a COMMISSION only role- we don't want to waste your time.

Commission Structure:

Appointment Setter: 10% fee for 1st-month client revenue, 2.5% passive income for each month thereafter
Closer: 20% fee for 1st-month client revenue, 5% passive income for each month thereafter

Example: A typical client we sign is valued at £2,500. Therefore, you would earn £500 for closing and £125x(11)=£1,375 every month after- we sign clients to either 6, 12 or 24-month contracts.

If you are interested and would like to apply, please send:
- Name
- Contact Details
- CV

Email: enquiries@bespokebranddevelopers.com by 30/06/2019.

Best wishes,

Joe Testouri
Founder
www.bespokebranddevelopers.com

items.title: Paid internship: Business Development UK

items.content:
Business Development Associate

KeyNest is a fast-growing network of shops where Airbnb hosts and Property Managers can securely store their keys so that their new tenants / guests / cleaners / contractors can pick them up whenever is convenient for them. We are a global partner of Airbnb and have checked-in more than 100,000 guests.
We’re looking for a Business Development Associate to grow our network of KeyNest Stores. This is a paid 3-6-month internship based in London.

The role:
• Recruit new Stores in London and the UK to join the KeyNest partner programme, in person and over the phone
• Liaise with our customers to find the best suitable partner
• Train and/or mystery shop our partner Stores where required
• Demonstrate an in-depth knowledge of our product offering to customers

Who we are looking for:
• Excellent communication and outgoing personality
• Available to travel extensively in and around London and occasionally outside
• Pro-active, self-motivated and work well in a team environment style
• Excellent English, knowledge of other languages a plus
• Experience as an Airbnb host / guest is a plus
• Available for 4 months minimum

What we offer:
• Weekly salary payment
• Possibility to be hired full-time or to continue working remotely whilst at university
• Unique chance to make your mark in a dynamic and very fast-growing company shaking up the sharing economy
• Central London office

If you want to join the KeyNest team, please get in touch at careers@keynest.com – we look forward to meeting you.

items.title: Brands Account Manager, Paris (London Based)
tags: DBG:surround``OR(locat, base, resid) 3W OR(berlin, london, pari)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
WHAT WE ARE UP TO AT APPEAR HERE

Appear Here is the leading marketplace for short-term retail space, working with everyone from industry leading brands to exciting start-ups. Our mission is to create a world where anyone with an idea can find space to make it happen. We’ve raised over $20m in funding to date - from tier one investors Balderton and Octopus, as well as some of the world’s largest landlords. Named one of Wired Magazine's ‘100 Hottest Start-Ups’ and The Financial Times’ most ‘Disruptive Companies,’ Appear Here has become the go-to destination to make innovative and creative retail ideas happen across London, Paris and New York. We believe we’re building a game changer for both the retail and property industries: and so far 120,000+ brands and 1000s of landlords agree with us.

As a Brand Account Manager for Paris, your role it to help brands find appropriate space on the platform to launch their ideas. Working with both small independent retailers looking to get their ideas off the ground and multi-nationals that want to run amazing campaigns. You will develop an in-depth knowledge of the French spaces on our platform, and be responsible for a sales pipeline of hundreds of brands at any one time. You will make large volumes of inbound and outbound correspondences per day (80 - 100+) so you should be high energy, comfortable picking up the telephone and have a passion for retail. Please note, this role is based in our London office but you will be working on deals for the French market. You must be a native French speaker with perfect written and spoken French, and business level English.

WHY WE LIKE YOU

- You are a native French speaker with perfect written and spoken French. Native Parisian is a distinct advantage. This role will be based alongside our UK Brand Account Managers in our Lodon office
- You're passionate about brands, have a solid understanding of retail, and an opinion on which brands are hot, and where they would fit in Paris
- You have experience in - or natural aptitude for - sales and get excited by punching for aggressive targets
- You're a great communicator who is comfortable speaking across telephone and email
- You have a natural flair for building rapport with people from all backgrounds
- You're scared by the 9-5; you want the adventure and hard work of coming in at the early stages and helping us build the future

THE ROLE

- Cultivate relationships with new and existing brands through phone calls, emails and some in-person visits to help them find the right space on our platform for their idea
- Respond to inbound enquiries from prospective brands in France, taking them through the Appear Here process
- Work with the Landlord team (remotely, they are based in the Paris office) to build your knowledge of the available spaces and to inform their space acquisition efforts
- Chip in and support on other projects or tasks that come up in the business -we're a startup and there's a lot to do!
- Find ways to improve our processes, bring your ideas to the table, and then execute on them! It's everyone's responsibility to figure out how to optimize everything!
- Research the brands' marketing and commercial strategies and creatively find ways to promote the use of short term retail space

THE TEAM

The Commercial Team is responsible for all aspects of helping brands find the right space for a successful short term rental on the AH platform. You will be working with a high energy, outgoing group who genuinely enjoys the work they do. Our backgrounds are varied, from asset management, and retail to tech-startups. Now we plan to build a billion dollar global property-tech revolution! We'll be listening to music and often stay late or work the odd weekend to hustle and get shit done. The team works hard because we love what we do and the brands we work with and we want you to as well.

WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT

Plenty of social activities, including board games evening at the office, product team nights out (bowling, darts, mini-golf, and more) and a monthly product team lunch at a local restaurant

Hear from amazing speakers within different industries. Appear Here hosts an 'Underground Session' event each month, inviting 4 experts to share their experiences and opinions. We also have an internal 'Global Gathering' once a year which includes exclusive talks from investors, industry-leading brands, and inspiring members of our community.

Sharing culture through our 'Product talks'. If you have learned something new, this is the place to share it with the team through a short presentation.

Friday lunch once a week our company comes together for a team lunch. This is an opportunity to get to know people from different teams while enjoying dishes from our favourite local restaurants.

SOME MORE PERKS

- Stock options. We believe everyone should be an owner.
- Scale with the business. This role offers the potential to have an incredible career trajectory.
- Team socials. From blindfolded martini making to sound baths, we organise quarterly team events that go big on experiences.
- Breakfast and snacks throughout the day (including our favourite cheeseboard).
- Work with different teams, across different projects.
- Best idea wins. Whether you’re an intern or the CTO, if you can make the case for it, we’ll make it happen.
- Opportunities and budget for personal learning development.
- Great location. We’re right next door to two of the best food markets in London. In your first week, we’ll send you out with different teams to show you the best eating spots.

items.content:
We are an exciting London based digital branding agency. We provide digital solutions for our clients through social media management, web design, and online marketing. We are currently in the process of expanding our team and growing our business operations as our number of international clients have increased

Currently maintaining strong client relationships and our internal company culture is the backbone to what makes Jelingu thrive as an agency and an essential element of our brand.



Job Post
New Client account & team manager


As a client account manager you would be responsible for managing your own portfolio of clients, new potential client and maintaining company account relationships.



Typical work activities

The role is broken into two parts:

Part1
Serve as the lead point of contact for all customer account management matters Build and maintain strong, long-lasting client relationships Negotiate contracts and close agreements to maximize profits Develop trusted advisor relationships with key accounts, customer stakeholders and executive sponsors Ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to customer needs and objectives Clearly communicate the progress of monthly/quarterly initiatives to internal and external stakeholders Develop new business with existing clients and/or identify areas of improvement to meet sales quotas Forecast and track key account metrics (e.g. quarterly sales results and annual forecasts) Prepare reports on account status Collaborate with sales team to identify and grow opportunities within territory


Part2
The second part of the role will involved interviewing, training and hiring new team members aswell as managing aspects of our internal operations. You will be answering all incoming calls .


Main duties in a nut shell

1. Answering calls from prospective clients

2. Trainning and inducting team members

3. Completing business proposals

4. Breifing design team

5. Creating management reports

6. Marinating the relationship between clients and the design team

7. Managing client accounts.


Requirements
• Exemplary planning and time management skills
• High level verbal and written communications skills
• Good understanding of building relationships
• We love people that can bring forward fresh ideas
• Creativity
• Brilliant people person and communications skills
• Keen to learn and grow with the company
• Business savvy


* No previous experience is necessary ongoing training will be provided.
The role is flexible and remote working can be incorporated.

If you feel you meet the criteria for this intern position we would love to hear from you. This intern position is flexible and we have long-term career opportunities for the right candidate. Educational credits can also be offered

Lydia is one of Europe’s fastest-growing fintech start-ups. Our mission is to make payments as simple as possible. How? By providing one app to pay for everything in all situations - from paying back a friend for last night’s pizza to buying lunch at a food market.
We launched Lydia in Paris in 2013, and we are now the number one mobile payments service in France. We have over 2 million users across France, the UK, Ireland, Spain, and Portugal, and more than 100,000 people create an account every month.
We’re looking for entrepreneurial, highly motivated talent to join our mission to become Europe’s universal means of payment. You will be working closely with the UK and Ireland teams to continue Lydia’s expansion into the Irish market. Your tasks will include key aspects of growing Lydia’s user-base in Ireland.

RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE
Identify business development opportunities in Ireland’s student sector
Conducting the whole sales cycle from prospecting, signing accounts, account management, and up-selling
Event planning and organisation
Social media management: assisting in creating content for the Lydia social media channels (Facebook, Twitter and Instagram).
Organising marketing projects
Creating marketing collateral documents
Contributing to social media strategy

REQUIREMENTS
Native or fluent in English (spoken and written), knowledge of Irish (Gaelic) / French is a plus
Recent graduate with excellent knowledge of the Irish student market
Extremely well-organised, detail-oriented, rigorous
Creative problem-solver with an analytical mindset
Proactive self-starter that can take initiative and seizes any challenge, no matter how big or small
Ability to multitask, can work under pressure
Excellent communication skills

BENEFITS
The opportunity to work at one of France’s fastest growing start-ups
Have a real impact on the company’s growth and evolution in a new market
Training in our Paris office

Start date: immediate
Compensation: according to experience
Contract type: freelance
Location: Ireland, remote

items.content:
Senior Accounts & Campaigns Manager

Based in London

£35,000 - £45,000 + Benefits

Deadline: Sunday 16th June 2019, 11:59pm

Application Method: CV and Covering Letter, both no more than 2 pages please.

Due to the high number of applications that we receive we are sadly unable to get back to everyone. If you haven’t heard from us by Wednesday 26th June 2019, it means that you haven’t been successful this time.

Semble is looking for an experienced accounts / campaigns manager to lead on the delivery of high profile, purpose led projects and campaigns.

● Do you have two or more years’ clearly demonstrable experience delivering high profile projects or campaigns in a busy environment

● Are you self-motivated, resilient, and with bags of energy?

● Do you have a track record of working with existing clients and partners to develop new opportunities?

● Do you believe in the power of communities and corporations coming together and taking positive action to change the world?


If that’s four big ticks from you then you should definitely read on! If it isn't, please, please, please don't apply for this particular role. These are essential requirements, and we'd hate you to waste your time.

1. What is the purpose of this role?

Ultimately you will be responsible for delivering some of the high-profile campaigns and projects in Semble’s growing portfolio.

A close second to that will be a natural flair and passion for ensuring that Semble is constantly striving to be the best that it can possibly be.

Thirdly, you will also need to be comfortable with spotting new opportunities and developing those, with the support of the new business team.

2. What are the key responsibilities for this role?

To ensure campaigns and projects are delivered to time and to budget
To ensure contracts and finances are well managed
To report and evaluate impact of the campaign
To ensure data is managed securely
To constantly strive to improve systems and processes
To ensure all partners are supported and kept up to date with the campaign as a whole
Managing members of the delivery team
3. What are the minimum skills, knowledge and experience needed for this role?

At least 3 years’ experience of end-to-end management of large purpose-led or change programmes, projects or campaigns
Experience of managing a diverse team, preferably including remote management
Experience of successfully developing relationships with external and internal clients and stakeholders at all levels
A clear and demonstrable understanding of what the challenges are when working for a small business or start-up
Experience of developing complex project plans and comfortable managing budgets and performance in a target driven environment
Experience of working within a tightly knit team, but needing to be largely self-motivated
Experience of developing and improving processes, tools and systems
Experience of using data for analysing and reporting on performance of a large campaign
Skilled at thinking creatively to develop new approaches and materials to further engage external stakeholders
Ability to manage own workload effectively
Ability to manage a team and build effective processes
Ability to use initiative and draw on experience in dealing with day-to-day tasks, risks and challenges
Desirable skills, knowledge and experiences

Experience of data protection and GDPR
Experience within, or working with, the community sector
Knowledge or experience of marketing and communications theory and practise, particularly for digital.
Experience of fundraising or proposal writing
Experience of Theory of Change journey
4. About Semble and Our Community
Semble is the UK’s most active network of community projects with an online platform that currently hosts over 3,500 environmental and social projects. We connect community projects with local people and companies who want to help them to achieve their goals and join their story.


Our vision is: Bring people together to make a change

For the last five years, Semble has been growing its platform for community projects nationally and developing an impressive client base. We’re building the team, developing our brand and platform, and are now looking for someone to help us super-charge our community!

We run projects such as #Made Local, #GreenerwithGreggs (an environmental fund for Greggs), #GivexCollaborate (a team-based volunteering campaign for Dentsu Aegis Network), #YourPintCan (a neighbourhood investment fund for Carling), and Outdoor Classroom Day (a global day to get over 20m children outdoors to learn & play at school, in partnership with Unilever and a network of NGOs). Last year we ran the Offline Festival for community businesses.

5. Benefits & Further Details
In this role, you will be working closely with the Head of Client Campaigns and the wider team. You will have significant opportunities for personal development and play an important role in developing and nurturing our community.

We have a lot of fun, with drinks evenings, picnics & team away days. Community volunteering is actively encouraged with each team member having 2 days per year to volunteer, and at least 2 days to visit community projects to find out more about how Semble can help them, and to collect stories and content for social media and the Semble platform.

Other benefits include:
• £35,000 – £45,000 depending on experience
• Central London location, with option of working remotely for part of the time
• 25 days holiday allowance p.a.• 25 days holiday allowance p.a.
• Pension contribution
• Clear training opportunities and career path progression
• Discretionary bonus scheme, related to business performance
• Shared gym membership

No Recruitment Agencies please, you do a great job but we’ve got this one covered.

items.content:
Title – Sales Development Representative (SDR)
Location – Central London, UK (Remote Workers Considered)
Hours – Flexible, typical day 1030 – 1830 (factoring in US Clients)

Overview

CircuitHub is expanding its Sales Team and is looking for Sales Development Representatives (SDRs) to help grow our customer base.

Who are CircuitHub?

CircuitHub is on a mission to fix rapid electronics prototyping. With the use of software and automated manufacturing, we are changing the way Printed Circuit Boards (PCBs) are assembled, speeding up production time, reducing costs, and dramatically improving the overall experience.

CircuitHub was founded in San Francisco, graduating from the infamous start-up accelerator Y-Combinator in 2014 and has since raised venture capital from the likes of Google Ventures and a number of other high-profile investors. CircuitHub has since relocated its factory to the East Coast in Massachusetts, as well as having a Central London office.

Responsibilities of an SDR

Lead Generation – Analysing what a potential customer for CircuitHub would look like and building prospecting lists of these profiles. This will primarily be US customer focused, although there will be an opportunity to take a more global view over time.

Prospect Outreach – You will be reaching out to these prospective customers via email and phone calls generating interest in CircuitHub’s offering.

Prospect Conversion – After generating interest you will aim to convert this interest into a customer registration and an appointment for a demo of the CircuitHub platform. An Account Executive will then manage this opportunity converting them into an active customer.

Support – Working for a start-up often means getting involved in many areas that fall outside of your core responsibilities. This will mean that you may regularly need to support other areas of the business. For example, helping out with customer demos, getting involved in Customer Support as well as any number of other areas.

Learning and Developing – During your day to day role you will be surrounded by lots of new information every day, be asked challenging and complex questions from customers and use various different internal systems. As a member of the CircuitHub team you will be responsible for rising to these challenges, seeking internal support as required, and then learning from this to better build your knowledge.

Experience and Skillset

• Graduate, or have at least 1 years B2B sales experience
• The ability to communicate incredibly well via email and phone
• The confidence to speak with prospective customers over the phone multiple times a day
• Demonstrate a willingness to work towards targets and be accountable for your performance
• Be self-motivated with the ability to work well independently
• Knowledge of Microsoft Office or GoogleDocs

Reward

Salary – You will be paid a competitive salary
Commission – You will receive monthly commission linked to your performance
Stock Options – You will receive stock options which will vest over time
Progression – You will be part of a growing team in a growing business, which will mean there will be plenty of opportunities to progress if you perform well in your role.

Digital Account Manager (part-time)

In Marketing We Trust

 Worldwide verified
**The Position Summary**

Title: Digital Marketing Account Manager
Location: Remote. APAC timezone
Reports to: Client Services Director
Works on: Company’s client projects
Key objectives: Managing several high profile client accounts

**The Company**

We are a digital analytics Agency and we are very good at Analytics, SEO, CRO, Data Science. Find out more about our services

Our motto: Traffic is nice. Revenue is better.

We have the most fun doing it in competitive environments such as finance, education, jobs, insurance, automotive and many more.

We strive on being an extension of our client’s team and providing tailor-made, return-focused work.
We are picky about the clients we bring on-board and very protective of our reputation. We won’t engage with a firm unless we believe we can make a difference to their business and help them Get Stuff Done!

This stops us from taking on board demoralising projects and having us hating our jobs and our clients.
We think the current agency model is broken and we really believe we can build a better alternative. But we need great people to help make this happen and that’s where you come in!

We are a bootstrapped company, we grew exponentially in the last few years and now seating at 60 people working with us.
We are built to be remote from day 1, but if you want to say ‘Hello’, our office is 78 meters from the beach in Sydney. Make sure you bring your swimwear!


**The Opportunity**

We are looking for a passionate and driven Account Manager to join our growing team. You will work on multiple client projects in support of our clients' strategic accounts expansion.

You will need a mix of creativity and strong analytical skills to identify sales opportunities for our company. You will support to develop and execute strategies and help turn those ideas in order to grow and gain more market visibility.

You will be required to develop and service relationships with key clients worldwide to provide strategic and creative sales opportunities across our platform

**What we offer you**

Career progression is based on your ability to deliver and drive ideas and difference for both the client and the company, not your ability to play politics or by the cut of your suit (in fact, we have a no suit policy).

A highly collaborative remote working environment, where teamwork is championed, and ideas shared - you will be someone who is unafraid of contributing ideas and happy to work as part of a remote team and in exchange for your hard work, we can give you a unique opportunity to shape and contribute to a flourishing business to achieve your lifestyle goals.

We even fly the team each year to our awesome TrustEDConf event. The last one was in October in Borneo.
An important point that is often overlooked: you will be truly part of a team. For most remote workers, you can easily feel isolated from what's happening in the business. We take good care of our teammates. So much so that a person who joined our team late November told us recently that she has felt more part of a team, than when she was working in an office.

Don't take our word for it. Check what our teammates are saying on glassdoor (yep, 2 reviews are not great, but most are).


# Responsibilities
* Managing several high-profile accounts
* Assist in creating the digital strategy for the clients
* Manage and monitor commercials of accounts, including workload for all delivery team and financials
* Ensure client expectations are clearly defined and properly managed
* Constantly liaise with the Delivery team
* Recommend, design and implement digital projects
* Oversee project management support during projects lifecycle to ensure on-time completion of deliverables
* Review work before client delivery to ensure it meets the brief and the expectations



# Requirements
**Ideal candidate**

* 3+ years of experience with professional client relationship management
* Digital Marketing and/ or Digital Analytics experience
* Demonstrable ability to multi-task
* In-depth knowledge of online marketing tools and technology
* Impeccable communication and people skills
* Strong analytical skills
* Can work under pressure with strict deadlines


**Attributes and behaviours we love to see**

* A can-do attitude
* Ownership of your work
* Inquisitive
* Analytical
* Creative in context
* Results orientated
* Collegiate and supportive
* A sense of humour

#Location
- Worldwide

items.content:
Account Executive 

Interview Schedule

 USA verified
**The Opportunity**

Interview Schedule is changing how teams hire. Our first product streamlines recruiting scheduling and coordination, saving teams hundreds of hours a month. We’re just getting started on, and have our sights set on making hiring a great experience for recruiters, hiring managers, and candidates. We’re building the platform to engage these key stakeholders and fix the $200 billion per year hiring industry.

This is an exceptional opportunity to join a small and fast-growing startup, transforming an industry with powerful and easy to use products customers love. As an early employee you'll have tons of ownership, a big impact on product, a say in our values, and opportunities to tremendously accelerate your career growth.

We're building a remote team and looking for the best individuals - no matter where you are. All we require is a reliable internet connection and passion for building an amazing company.

**What We’re Looking For**

This person is excited about scaling the revenue side of a business. They’re a salesperson first, always customer-focused, thoughtful about creating and scaling processes, and eager to own (and crush) a revenue number.

Initially, this job will consist primarily of selling (from prospect to close). There will be many other hats to wear – potentially ranging from demand gen, to CS, to support, and even product thinking – and this person is excited to take on new challenges.

At Interview Schedule we believe in ownership and accountability, and this person is eager to own and be accountable for revenue growth. They’re always looking for ways to add the most value, which may shift and evolve over time.

**What We Value**

In addition to ownership and accountability, we believe in: challenging the status quo, having empathy, being direct, being honest, and that nothing is “not my job.”

**What We Offer**

* Autonomy, impact, and ownership. As an early employee you’ll shape the product direction and company values.
* Competitive salary and significant equity in a fast growing, early stage startup.
* Remote employment - work where you want, when you want.
* Generous vacation policy - take time whenever you need to recharge. Building a lasting company is a marathon, not a sprint.
* Top-notch healthcare, dental, and vision coverage.
* Life and disability insurance.
* Annual company retreat - helps build camaraderie as a remote team.
* Computer and home office setup - we'll buy anything you need to do your best work.
* Continuing education allowance - learn what you want, when you want.

#Location
- USA

items.content:
Sales Development Representative (SDR)

TaxJar is the leading technology solution for busy eCommerce sellers to manage sales tax and is trusted by more than 15,000 businesses. Our mission is to make eCommerce easier for everyone.

Our core values:

  • We do the right thing for our customers.
  • We're a team, built on trust.
  • We're proud to be remote.
  • We're in control of our own destiny.

TaxJar’s remote-only team of 90 people is growing fast. We’re currently looking for a Sales Development Representative (SDR) who wants to make a difference on a growing, experienced team of entrepreneurs.
We are looking for a someone who is fanatical about helping businesses succeed while working across other functions of the organization to ensure an exceptional customer experience and drive revenue. Ensuring the happiness of our customers is everything to us.
The right candidate will be someone who enjoys speaking with people, has great organizational and communication skills, and is a team player who can work well across marketing, sales, and customer success.

As a Sales Development Representative (SDR) you will

  • Assist with supporting TaxJar’s marketplace eCommerce customers evaluating our TaxJar Basic solution
  • Qualify opportunities and Help build the pipeline for TaxJar Plus
  • Learn, collaborate and have fun on a daily basis!
  • Front lines for answering phones and following-up voice messages
  • Handling calls and leads for Amazon/marketplace customers
  • Assigning new accounts and opportunities in Salesforce
  • Scheduling calls/demos for sales
  • Qualifying new TaxJar Plus opportunities
  • Supporting outbound sales initiatives

REQUIREMENTS:
  • 0-3 years experience
  • Strong phone skills
  • Rapid learner with ability to work in a fast paced, high growth environment
  • Highly-skilled in written and verbal communications (chat, video, email, etc)
  • Knowledge of Salesforce.com applications preferred
  • BS/BA degree
  • Interested in learning solution sales and growing into an Account Executive role

You’ll be a great fit for TaxJar if you:

  • Have a passion for remote work
  • Are a PRO at communicating and collaboration
  • Highly value working with people you like and respect
  • Are accountable
  • Are confident in your skills and a solid team player (We’re peers here, no egos please)
  • Hungry to play an impactful role and not afraid to fail

We’re a happy team and we all really love what we do. We've created a space where high-achievers can succeed, but are also safe to fail. We're profitable and focused on growing TaxJar sustainably. We're always learning how to make TaxJar the best place to work for all of us, and not just another tech startup. We’re always looking for an amazing new teammates to come share in the excitement of solving real-world problems with technology.

BENEFITS

items.content:
Sales Executive: HVAC

Pearl Certification seeks an experienced, motivated, and successful educational salesperson to recruit and vet high-quality HVAC contractors for the national Pearl Contractor Network. Seize the opportunity to join a vibrant, dedicated, and supportive team as we scale a dynamic start-up and create a national brand.

Pearl Certification’s elite contractor network provides high-quality HVAC, envelope, solar and other contractors with exclusive tools to enhance their business. Network contractors certify their work through Pearl's platform, enabling their customers to recapture the value of their home improvement investments when they sell or refinance their homes. (Pearl Certification can increase a home’s value by 5% or more.) Pearl network contractors also have access to a rich suite of sales and marketing tools to help them leverage their ability to offer third-party certification into larger ticket sizes and higher close rates (5% - 15%)! More details here: https://pearlcertification.com…

This position will require strong, consultative sales skills. It also requires an ability to target contractor candidates effectively, because Pearl only admits extremely high-quality contractors into its network. A successful candidate will be able to juggle these competing priorities simultaneously.

Pearl is a fully distributed team, made up of industry professionals and past contractors. This position can be located anywhere in the continental US.

Requirements

  • Proven success with B2B sales
  • Experience in HVAC or related residential contracting industry
  • Outstanding written and verbal communications skills
  • Passion for Pearl's product and excitement about helping contractors understand how it can help them grow their businesses
  • Ability to work independently
  • Experience with complex sales and/or new-to-market products
  • Ability and willingness to travel
  • Impeccable references

Preferences

  • 5 years+ experience selling to HVAC Companies directly
  • An existing national professional network
  • Start-up level business experience

Responsibilities

  • Qualify candidates to ensure they meet Pearl's high standards for membership
  • Educate and guide qualified candidates (specifically contractor business owners and leadership) through the admissions process
  • Close on new contractor business
  • Work closely with Contractor Success team to ensure a positive hand-off experience and provide follow-up support as accounts are brought into the network

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation composed of a mix of salary plus commission
  • Excellent medical, dental and vision benefits
  • Intensive training and support from a passionate team dedicated to your success
  • Early entry into a rapidly-growing start-up with tremendous growth opportunities
  • Make a difference! For your income, our customers, the company's bottom line - and hundreds of thousands of homeowners who will benefit from lower bills, greater energy efficiency, better indoor air quality, and increased value of their homes

items.content:
Account Executive

DESCRIPTION

As an Account Executive, you will be responsible for helping new leads evaluate how Marker.io can help them solve their business challenges.

We’re seeking someone with sales experience, ideally from a SaaS background, to join our new sales team. So far, all our sales efforts have been done by our founders, and we are looking for someone that will help improve our processes and effectiveness.

We approach sales from an educational mindset, and pride ourselves on being product-experts, so we can help customers solve their problems. We believe that the best way to sell is by “helping”, not “selling”.

You should have an understanding of the evolution of SaaS sales (self-service free trial) and be able to apply that to building a sales pipeline that drives successful onboarding during trials, and closes the ideal leads. The majority of leads come from various inbound channels such as SEO, content marketing, guest blogging, partnerships and marketplaces.

You’ll be responsible for qualifying and closing inbound 14-day free trial sign-ups into successful Marker.io customers. You’ll spend a lot of time talking with leads and getting to know our ideal customers. A typical day-in-the-life would be answering incoming sales and emails, scheduling and hosting demos and converting prospects into customers (a full-stack sales process).

You will work closely with the Product team to report customer insights and help improve our onboarding experience which helps leads convert. You will also work closely with Marketing to help define and prioritize the best lead generation initiatives to attract more of our ideal customers into our pipeline.

While we accept both on-site and remote candidates for this role, we require that remote candidates be located in Europe or on the Eastern coast of America. We accept a maximum of 6-hour difference with our headquarters in Brussels, Belgium.

What you’ll do
  • Call qualified leads shortly after they sign up to our free trial and qualify them based on our ideal customer profile.
  • Schedule and perform product demos and present webinars for both prospects and customers.
  • Help leads and customers get properly set up with Marker.io to ensure that they can be successful using the product.
  • Answer inbound sales related questions from leads and customers via chat, emails, and phone.
  • Follow up with prospects during and beyond the trial period.
  • Be able to identify “nice-to-have” from “deal-breaker” features during customer calls and be creative suggesting product workarounds.
  • Develop a deep understanding of our product to help leads and customers find a solution to their problems.
  • Share and document insights with the product team based on customer feedback and help improve onboarding experience
  • Partner with Marketing to create and drive new lead generation campaigns.
  • Create customer facing content (such as helpdesk articles, screencast, ..) that can easily be shared with leads and customers to help them evaluate and set up their account properly
  • Keep CRM up do date to reflect the real situation of our opportunities in our Sales pipeline.
  • Able to think strategically and propose ways to scale our sales efforts when possible, while still keeping our approach personal and educational.
  • Report on key activity and performance metrics such as # of calls made, # of demos delivered, # of leads qualified, # of new customers and $ amount of new MRR add each month.

REQUIREMENTS

  • You experience working in a sales or customer-facing position, ideally in SaaS
  • You have a track record of performance
  • You speak and write in perfect English
  • You are a “product geek” , meaning you are able to develop strong understanding and technical knowledge in order to speak confidently to customers and communicate their needs to our team.
  • Be comfortable taking calls and closing deals while also thinking strategically about growing our sales efforts.
  • You see yourself more as a “consultant” than a pure “sales guy or gal”. You understand that the best way to sell, is to help.
  • You get a kick out of talking with customers and figuring out creative solution for their problems.
  • You are naturally empathetic, meaning you are comfortable talking to different types of potential customers from multiple industries and technical abilities.
  • You are familiar with the project management and issue tracking tool space. You know what Jira, Trello, Asana, Github and Gitlab are and you’ve worked with them in the past.
  • You have the startup mentality: you love figuring out creative ways to get the best maximum results with minimal resources

BENEFITS

  • Competitive salary: Our compensation packages are based on market research and are equitable to other roles within Marker.io. The actual compensation offered to a successful candidate will be based on relative experience and skills.
  • Technology: Get a new MacBook Pro laptop with all necessary accessories (e.g.: second screen monitor, mouse, keyboard, laptop stand, adaptors,…). Basically anything you need to work in an environment you like.
  • Transparent salary: Your compensation package is accessible to anyone internally to encourage transparency and understand how you can grow inside the company. Your salary is calculated by taking into account market rates for your skillset, your relevant experience and the influence and ownership associated with your role.
  • Flexible working hours: As long as you are able to collaborate with your team effectively, get your work done and display the right attitude, it doesn't really matter when you start and finish your day.
  • Flexible holidays: Beyond your legal number of days off and public holidays, we trust you to take a few more paid extra off days if you feel it's important for your well-being.
  • Learning & personal development budget: Get a yearly budget for paid conferences, trainings, online courses and books.
  • Company retreats and activities: We regularly organize company dinners and activities to spend time together in a different and fun environment.
  • Profit Sharing: It's very important to us that we redistribute part of the value created with you, the actual contributor. We decided that the best way to share the success of the business with you was via a profit sharing program.
  • Career Evolution Roadmap: Depending on how fast you want to grow inside the team, we work with you from day 1 to lay out a plan that will allow you to achieve your professional and personal goals. We also regularly meet with you to assess your progress and figure out together what needs to be done to achieve your aspiration.
  • Great office or co-working space: We work in the heart of Brussels city in a great office with tons of space. Bars, cafes, and restaurants are only minutes away by foot. Access by tram, metro, train and bus is super easy. If you decide to work remotely, we will cover your co-working expenses.


Who will I work with?

Our team is composed of 5 people, with backgrounds ranging from Marketing, Product Management, Front-end dev, Back-end dev all the way to DevOps architect. We also have the chance to have an awesome advisor who is David Darmain, the CEO of HotJar, a massively successful startup in the feedback and analytics space.

items.content:
Sales Representative - Technology

Join us in making a positive difference for our public agency clients.

Comcate is looking for a full-time sales person committed to making a difference in helping State and Local governments improve their effectiveness and better serve their citizens with our SaaS technology.

For the right Candidate, remote work is a possibility.

Who you are:

•Committed to working with local government and providing tech-savvy solutions for agency staff and citizens!

•You’re full of energy and a self-starter, working hard to set sales goals and exceed them.

•The sales process excites you, from uncovering leads to closing the deal and being rewarded for it.

•You can understand issues quickly and you’re a great listener but you also know how to communicate clearly with anyone from Company Presidents to IT Staff.

Initial Responsibilities:

•Generate, develop and own sales opportunities with State and Local agencies /municipalities. Support strategies for winning in competitive environments.

•Manage all leads, screening and conversion to opportunities.

•Prepare all written responses, proposals and on-line demos.

•Perform targeted outbound calling and email campaigns.

•Meet and exceed quarterly targets.

•Document all conversations, activities and emails in our Salesforce CRM.

Future Responsibilities (once initial responsibilities are met):

•Understand complex customer requirements including the needs of prospects at different levels in the organization.

•Ability to understand different persona's needs in an organization and the ability to navigate within organizations with different personas.

•Provide feedback on marketing efforts and marketing materials, based on customer input.

•Become a subject matter expert in our solutions.

•Clearly articulate business value propositions to prospects over the phone and internet. This includes performing web-demonstrations of software.

Qualifications:

•1-4 years of proven success in meeting/exceeding sales targets (However if you are an upbeat college grad who’s super daring, we want to speak with you!)

•Significant interest in technology and ability to demonstrate comfort working with technology.

•Interest in public agencies.

•Passionate work-ethic.

•Preferred: understanding of public agencies and their purchasing processes.

•Experience in a competitive sales cycle is highly preferred but not required.

•Possess a high energy, strong desire to achieve top results with a charismatic, positive “can-do” attitude via the phone and in person.

•Highly proficient in Salesforce, Google Suite and online based applications.

While this is an entry level position, Comcate is committed to providing competitive compensation based on experience, and offering opportunities for career advancement.

For the right candidate, Comcate offers:

• Competitive Base + incentive commission depending on experience

• No cap on income!

• Leadership position in a growing, entrepreneurial company with room for advancement

• Freedom to manage yourself and leverage best practices for success

• Creative, team oriented, collaborative environment

• Attractive benefits including health, equity, 401K company match, and competitive paid time off

Our CONFIDENTIAL recruiting process begins with submitting a resume and cover letter. No phone calls, or faxes will be accepted.

items.content:
Sales Development Representative at Protegrity

Remote
  • Stamford, CT
  • Full Time
  • Sales
  • Entry Level

Job Description: Sales Development Representative (Enterprise Sales)

Location: Stamford, CT

Protegrity is at an important moment in our company’s history.

Our culture is a mixture between a well-established company with a 15-year history developing industry leading data security software solutions; combined with a startup environment focused on innovation and continuous iteration and process improvement.

Our customers make up some of the world’s largest and most well-respected companies in the key industries such as banking, retail, insurance who trust Protegrity to protect their most sensitive data.

Now it’s time to scale.

The Sales Development Representative (SDR) will generate meetings with prospective customers for our sales team. The overall goal is to build pipeline by uncovering and advancing qualified sales opportunities.

The SDR will work directly with our experienced Account Executives and have the opportunity to learn the tricks of the enterprise software sales trade while building critical pipeline.

The ideal candidate is seeking to jumpstart or re-invigorate their career by aligning their work into two of the world’s hottest industries: data & cybersecurity.

Prior industry experience is not required, but a genuine appetite for learning, innovating, and geeking out about business technology is critical.

There is significant room for growth and intercompany mobility as Protegrity expands at a rapid pace.

Requirements:

  • Experience working in an entrepreneurial environment
  • Curiosity with a focus on continuous iteration and process improvement
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills. – You will work with various internal departments, as well as prospective customers.
  • Highly organized and able to adapt to changing priorities
  • Technical aptitude. You can learn new programs and have a knack for picking them up quickly

A day in the life…

The SDR will work directly with the sales team strategizing and then executing outbound lead generation efforts (cadence of calls, emails, LinkedIn messages) to prospects at target accounts leveraging our www.Outreach.io sales engagement tool. This incredible tool sits on top of Salesforce so you won’t have to worry about manually logging calls and emails into CRM.

In addition to collaboration with the sales team – the SDR partners with Protegrity’s marketing department following up on inbound leads and various marketing campaigns.

Once the SDR sparks the interest of the right prospects from target and strategic accounts into meeting with the Protegrity sales team – you’ll then listen in on calls, takes notes and familiarize yourself with our solutions and how we provide business value by solving data security and privacy problems for our customers.

Traits:

  • You are a thinker and a doer, allowing you to contribute big ideas but also be hands-on when it comes to implementing those ideas.
  • You speak your mind, have no issue raising concerns with other company leaders, but are also able to “disagree and commit” when things don’t go your way.
  • When you don’t know how to do something, you’ll admit it and make a quick assessment of whether it’s something you can figure out, if you’ll need help, and where that help should come from.
  • Flexible location. You can work remotely or be based out of our offices in Stamford, CT or Milpitas, CA.
Apply for job

items.title: Shogun: Account Executive (Shogun YC W18)
items.content:
Account Executive (Shogun YC W18)

We are: Shogun, a powerful page builder and AB testing platform for eCommerce stores. We were in the Winter 2018 batch of Y-Combinator, and we have over 10,000 active paying clients!

We are looking for: An Account Executive to join our 25 person team and work with our cofounders to perform lead generation, outreach campaigns, attend meetings and events, conduct product demos, and maintain our CRM.

We need someone that is incredibly organized, detail oriented, and ambitious, with experience maintaining a CRM database of prospects, and creating and following a strict process for outreach and follow up.

This role will make a huge impact on the business, and there will be an opportunity to grow with our marketing and growth team.

----

You must:

-Be incredibly detail and process oriented.
-Have experience with maintaining a CRM platform like Hubspot, Salesforce, Copper etc. If you set up the CRM, even better. We use Hubspot.
-Have experience with, or strong understanding of, running email outreach campaigns, and creating automated email sequences and follow ups.
-Be comfortable cleaning and segmenting contact data in Google Sheets or MS Excel.
-Have meticulous note taking abilities. Ability to create clear action items, and execute follow up.
-Be comfortable participating in software demos, meetings, and conferences.
-Have the ability to learn how software works, and memorize key facts about the software.
-Be a self starter that defaults to action.
-Have at least 1-3 years of experience with sales development.
-Have a few references we can say hi to.


We offer:

-Competitive compensation
-Equity
-A skilled team that is fun to work with
-The ability to work from wherever you want in the world.
-The opportunity to help build the business development side of a company from the ground up


Sounds interesting?
Send an email to jobs@getshogun.com and include:

-Your resume.
-A short introduction.
-A list of 3 sales tools/softwares that you have experience with.

Please note:
-Our team is fully distributed and global (check out our team page!). We have no office. You should be comfortable with remote work.
-We hire on a full time contractor basis to begin with. Team members enjoy the same opportunities for great compensation, full time positions, equity, and consideration, regardless of location.

items.title: Account Executive
items.content:
Account Executive at Interview Schedule

Remote | International
  • Growth
  • Remote

The Opportunity

Interview Schedule is changing how teams hire. Our first product streamlines recruiting scheduling and coordination, saving teams hundreds of hours a month. We’re just getting started on, and have our sights set on making hiring a great experience for recruiters, hiring managers, and candidates. We’re building the platform to engage these key stakeholders and fix the $200 billion per year hiring industry.

This is an exceptional opportunity to join a small and fast-growing startup, transforming an industry with powerful and easy to use products customers love. As an early employee you’ll have tons of ownership, a big impact on product, a say in our values, and opportunities to tremendously accelerate your career growth.

We’re building a remote team and looking for the best individuals – no matter where you are. All we require is a reliable internet connection and passion for building an amazing company.

What We’re Looking For

This person is excited about scaling the revenue side of a business. They’re a salesperson first, always customer-focused, thoughtful about creating and scaling processes, and eager to own (and crush) a revenue number.

Initially, this job will consist primarily of selling (from prospect to close). There will be many other hats to wear – potentially ranging from demand gen, to CS, to support, and even product thinking – and this person is excited to take on new challenges.

At Interview Schedule we believe in ownership and accountability, and this person is eager to own and be accountable for revenue growth. They’re always looking for ways to add the most value, which may shift and evolve over time.

What We Value

In addition to ownership and accountability, we believe in: challenging the status quo, having empathy, being direct, being honest, and that nothing is “not my job.”

What We Offer

  • Autonomy, impact, and ownership. As an early employee you’ll shape the product direction and company values.
  • Competitive salary and significant equity in a fast growing, early stage startup.
  • Remote employment – work where you want, when you want.
  • Generous vacation policy – take time whenever you need to recharge. Building a lasting company is a marathon, not a sprint.
  • Top-notch healthcare, dental, and vision coverage.
  • Life and disability insurance.
  • Annual company retreat – helps build camaraderie as a remote team.
  • Computer and home office setup – we’ll buy anything you need to do your best work.
  • Continuing education allowance – learn what you want, when you want.
Apply for job

items.content:
Telemarketing Sales / Call Center Manager

  • Are you a highly skilled and customer-centric telemarketing or call center manager leader with a proven track record?
  • Looking for a company with real growth opportunity for you? Tired of jumping around?
  • How about a place where you’ll actually be recognized and rewarded for your contribution?
  • Want to work as part of an ALL-STAR team that’s really making a difference in the world?
  • Want a genuine virtual position where you can work from home as an EMPLOYEE and with GREAT BENEFITS?!

Look… I know you’re busy and we all know there are tons of boring and repetitive job postings lacking transparency out there, so I’ll just dive right on in here…

I have a RARE and EXCITING opportunity here for the right person…

My name is Ryan Withrow, and I am the Director of Telemarketing here at The Healthy Back Institute. We help people live without pain, naturally and safely. MILLIONS of people, literally all over the world. We do this via cutting-edge educational information, breakthrough products and by providing truly loving care and service to our customers. That’s right, we don’t want to hire anyone unless they have genuine care for our customers. Period.

Right now, we are growing FAST (we’ve grown every year since we started the company way back in 2003) and I need to build and strengthen my already strong team. That’s why I’m looking to fill this Telemarketing Manager position with someone that has true all-star talent.

Here’s a summary of the role…

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Telemarketing Manager position will focus on driving profitable sales growth through our modern virtual work from home contact center while creating an incredible customer experience.

You will partner and collaborate with other leadership teams ensure all actions and implementations are congruent with overall company culture, structure and needs. You will be responsible for executing a customer-centric strategy connected across multiple phone channels and for driving results through departmental KPIs. You must have a hands-on approach in leading and implementing new programs to optimize the customer experience and grow the department’s sales figures.

The role requires a strong combination of people management and project management. You will “own” or be responsible for everything having to do with the telemarketing sales of our products, recruiting and hiring, data analysis, team management, coaching, customer satisfaction, process optimization… and more.

You must be able to get things done through others as well as execute on your own. So the role is a mix of directing, managing and executing. You can’t be afraid to get your hands dirty!

Since the role will be virtual, you should be able to prove that you have produced consistent, excellent results while working remote for an extended period in the past.

You will be required to do a small amount of travel for executive team meetings, our annual company retreat and other relevant seminars, events, etc. All travel is paid for by the company.

THE SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL:

  • Analyze, prepare, and report all department data with an extreme focus for solution engineering to optimize agent, departmental and company performance
  • Communicate, collaborate and partner effectively at all levels of the organization from the executive team to the hourly workforce; exhibit executive presence in all channels and interactions
  • Own the daily operations of the telemarketing teams as the leading point of contact for the Director of Telemarketing, proactively providing insight and recommendations as needed; first responder to priority issues.
  • Collaborate with the operations team to review people, processes and technologies to maximize experience, efficiencies and effectiveness in all channels employing modern strategies and innovations.
  • Lead the culture of ongoing development by example; work collaboratively and side-by-side with other leaders in the organization to bring to life leadership model that drives improved performance
  • Identify and prioritize areas needing attention or improvement in our sales processes and/or customer experience and develop sound action plans to make improvements happen
  • Exhibit a passion to build and create growth and operation strategies to ensure a seamless customer-centric journey and deliver world-class customer experiences while driving growth and managing sales channels
  • Drive increased sales and work with agents and supervisors of all 3 existing sales teams (inbound, retention, and outbound)

TO BE CONSIDERED YOU MUST…

HAVE STRONG EXPERIENCE IN THESE AREAS:

  • 3 years+ Telemarketing Sales Experience
  • 2 Years+ Telemarketing Sales Manager / Director
  • Both Virtual and In-Office Management
  • Proven track record of increasing sales KPIs and growing team members
  • Must have an INCREDIBLE customer-centric focus

HAVE “EXPERT” LEVEL SKILL IN THESE AREAS:

  • Excellent analytical skills (financial analysis, performance data, agent deliverables, campaign performance)
  • Data analysis visual aid creation (Google Docs/ Microsoft Excel / Access / SQL, v-lookups, pivot tables, complex formulas, etc)
  • Project management - ability to manage multiple projects with different resources, priorities and timelines
  • Management and optimization of telemarketing operations
  • Working with technology/platforms as well as tech teams regularly (must be a solutions engineer)
  • Ability to work independently without significant supervision

NOT REQUIRED, BUT NICE TO HAVE:

  • Experience in nutritional supplement or other health related business
  • Experience working for a direct response company

DO THESE TRAITS DESCRIBE YOU?

  • Driven - determined to be successful and meet or exceed goals
  • Optimizer - a knack and love of making things better
  • Strategic - Has vision and can create well thought out plans
  • Analytical - Can easily identify trends, patterns, problems and create solutions
  • Organized - Able to manage multiple projects on time and on budget
  • Productive - Is stellar at managing time and understanding the 80/20 of efforts
  • Detail oriented - Thrives on the details, data, and digging into it when needed
  • Great communicator - Superior written and verbal communication
  • High energy & drive – Relentless, passionate, self-starter, super determined
  • Responsible - Thrives on accountability and ownership on tasks, projects, etc.
  • Resourceful - Easily finds ways to CRUSH bottlenecks and implements fast.
  • Team Player – Collaborates well, loves to see the TEAM win.
  • Humorous - Enjoys having fun doing what they love with us.
  • Change Junkie - Thrives on changes in the workplace.
  • Approachable - Easily hears and listens to others feedback, requests, etc.
  • Leans In to Friction - Able to have the hardest of required conversations and deal with them as a true leader in the organization.

Yes, I know, it’s a long list and you likely don’t meet all of these criteria… as I said at the start of this letter, I really am looking for that rare gem, it’s an unusual combination to find…

But, if you are that rare unicorn and you meet all of the above criteria, I definitely want to hear from you… please fill out the online application ASAP…

And if you don’t possess them all, but are damn close (I’m talking over 90%), then please apply and WOW me with your answers to the questions… because I’d love to learn more about you and see if we think it’s a mutual match.

NOW IT’S DECISION TIME...

If this job posting has scared you, offended you or annoyed you in anyway, then we know this is not for you and I appreciate you checking this opportunity out and I wish you the best.

If, however, you love my honesty, openness, sense of humor and are a true super-star performer and are up for a fun but very rewarding challenge, I would love to hear from you.

IMPORTANT... BEFORE YOU APPLY:

If you do not meet the criteria as outlined above, please don’t waste your time or ours by filling out the application. We hate wasting time… and I bet you don’t like to, either… so please, only apply if you seriously feel this role is one you are very interested in, you feel you are a great match, and you meet all (or 90%) of the criteria outlined above.

Here’s a little bit more about why you might want to join us…

BENEFITS & PERKS:

  • Work life balance / flexible schedule
  • Remote / virtual work from home position
  • Above average compensation
  • Performance based bonuses
  • 401k
  • Medical, dental, life and disability insurance
  • Paid vacation and time off (PTO)
  • Paid travel
  • Annual team retreat in exotic location
  • Paid continuing education
  • Discount on HBI products
  • True rock-star, family like team
7 Reasons You Might Love Working Here

#1 Stability

We've been in business since 2003 and have gone through many of the "rough patches" already. We are now a very strong and healthy company and aren't going anywhere for a very long time. In 2011 we were awarded a spot in the Inc 500/5000 coming in at #595. We are profitable, debt-free and have no outside investors... so we always do what we feel is right and this is a stable environoment.

#2. Opportunity

Unlike most companies that want to keep your pay as low as they can, we do the opposite! Our goal is to pay you as much as we possibly can because when we do, we know that means you are creating tremendous value for our customers and our business. We only want A-level superstars so we offer above average compensation as well as company and performance-based bonuses.

#3. Flexibility

Location doesn't matter to us. I don't care if you're working on the beach, your kitchen, or in your backyard. As long as you have fast, reliable internet, a quiet working space and you produce results, we are happy!

#4. Freedom

We believe that all people deserve to be free... free to make their own choices... free to create their own success... and we strive to create a work environment that not only allows but empowers you to be creative and take risks (well thought out of course). No company politics or popularity contests. We are a team of "producers"... people who are results oriented and believe that each person should be responsible for themselves.

#5. Great People

You'd be joining an existing team of superstars, many of whom have been with the company for years. There is virtually no “drama” within the team that most companies have. Everybody is fun, passionate, great at what they do, and willing to help out. If you're that kind of person – you'll fit in perfectly.

#6. Training and Education

We invest heavily in our knowledge and skills. As part of our team you'll have access to an enormous library of "how to" and "self improvement" books and courses and we also reimburse our team when they invest in continued education.

#7. Growth

We are growing at warp speed and have continued to increase profits year after year. This growth also means growth for you... in knowledge, skills, relationships and income.
